description:
Quick Summary
- Good food, light portions
- Cute interior
- Seating is limited
- Wait time can happen before sitting down and during the meal experience
- Require some self-service (menu and paying out) due to limited staff

We were planning to visit a concert, so we decided to eat somewhere near the venue. This was my first time visiting the Hayes area, and I was amazed to see so many food restaurants. My family and I decided on a Thai cuisine; it has been a cuisine I added into the list of food to try and eat. 

The restaurant is pretty and also cozy, which also meant the seating area is few. There were empty chairs and tables, but we waited until the staff directed us to a table. This took a little time for it looked like there was only one staff who was taking orders. After sitting down, it also took a while to retrieve the menu. Right beside our table, there was a stand that stored menus. We first debated if we were supposed to get the menu on our own or wait until the staff delivered it to us. Eventually, the staff did deliver our menus, but it was an unusual moment. 

The time when taking the order and the order arriving was fast. The time to receive a check is a hurdle, so if you are on a time crunch (concert or a performance is happening soon), I would recommend leaving your table and paying it at the counter. 

Jumping to the food, we ordered the Thai fried rice, Pad see-ew, and the crispy calamari. Two members of the family drank coffee, so we decided to order lightly. The portions are good for a light eater, but the crispy calamari helped finish the meal with a full stomach. My favorite is the fried rice. It is the taste I like: the subtle toasty flavor. We ordered to have the pork option and it went well. The pork is cut into bite-sized pieces and the meat is tender, so is easy to eat.

The Pad See-ew was delicious too. The noodle was flat, wide, and very thin. I think that helps absorb the sauce and flavors. The thickness is easy to eat with a fork. We have ordered it with the beef option, so the flavors were bold and very good. The vegetables were cooked tender, so there was no chewing hassle. 

Lastly, the appetizer, the crispy calamari. I am very glad we have ordered this because I was feeling of eating squid. The squid was tender and sweet, and the fried batter was crispy. It was cooked with onions and the sweetness of the onion brought out a mellow flavor. 
This appetizer came with a sauce: a combination of mayonnaise, siriachia, and wasabi. This went very very good with the fried squid. I don't eat wasabi very much because I don't like the punching pain in the nose. However, the wasabi gave a fresh taste in the mayonnaise sauce. 

The food was very good, and I enjoyed my visit. The only downside was that because there was a wait time for the lonely staff running about, there were tables of impatient customers. Again, I would recommend to take the menu to your table and pay at the counter.
author: Mito I.

description:
After SF jazz last night, this spot was near the parking spot we found. Having played golf earlier the last thing i wanted was a restaurant in HV (Hayes Valley) with a line out the door or having to walk forever to find something. The place was so empty we thought it was closed. But no it closes at 11 and considering it was a bit after 9, I figured we must be between foodie rushes. Bae has met co-workers here for lunch and vouched for it being decent. 
The signature dish I compare all Thai places to is the pad Thai I had in Bangkok with Shrimp and fried tofu.  So I got it here. 
Great value for $16 bucks! It was not the best nor far from the worse. 

Service was strange another test I have is if they bring out the trilogy of spices when I ask for hot spice. 
They only brought me sambal olek (chili garlic sauce) which I added liberally. Normally the trilogy has pickled Thai chilies, sambal and a dry chili. I know they have it. Because as the restaurant started filling up, a solo guy who was very particular ordered (no I wasn't dipping in on his conversation, he was just that loud) got it in the sliver holder with 3 glass jars of spices. I suppose I had to be particular. The waitress who took the order from me was stunned. Apparently I made the order of shrimp pad Thai in a very close Thai accent. She looked at me really hard with a smile said you don't look It but you order with Thai accent. Which should have been an indication that the chili trilogy should have come with my dinner. 

Anyway the pad Thai was a huge portion with fresh noods, sprouts, lime wedge, nuts off to the side, lots of giant prawns and plenty of big cubes of tofu. We couldn't finish it. (I hoped to make some homeless soul happy by handing over the paper carton as we walked back to the car, no homeless in sight!) it needed heat and sambal didn't bring it up to Bae keeping her fork outta the plate hot. 
Fortunately I have Thai chili's at home swimming in my own rice vinegar/ fish sauce with a bit of Stevia and sliced shallots concoction. That should make left overs a hot delight!
author: Craig G.

description:
This place is a very solid but perhaps unremarkable Thai place.

The most important part here is that I think they're a pretty solid deal, although admittedly I don't know as much about delivery as eating in. I used allset to dine-in quickly, and:
- The food was reasonably priced
- There was a TON of it
- It was pretty good if not amazing
- The staff was attentive and friendly (mostly)

I got the Chicken Pad Thai, which is my gold standard (along with larb) for Thai food, and it was...alright. At first I was even a little disappointed since it's clearly anglicized - it had a garlicky taste and was missing some of the real savory, rich notes that the best Pad Thai has (not to mention any nuttiness). 

The more I ate, though, the more I discovered it was actually pretty solid. For one, this place has probably The Best Fried Tofu I've had, bar none. Their was plenty of it and it was fried to perfection - just the perfect golden outside, perfectly cooked inside. For another, this is probably the largest single portion of Pad Thai I've ever been served. For the finale, I discovered how delicious adding spice to this really made it. They'll bring out three kinds of things to spice-it-up, and they're all *really* solid. Their spicy sauce and flakes are spot-on, and the jalapeño juice really brings out the flavors.

The other funny thing was that the place was totally empty (granted it was 445PM, not a common time for dinner) when I waked in, and it took them several minutes to notice I had arrived. Beyond that, though, they were great about bringing water, etc.

I guess you could say the whole experience started off on an unimpressively but ended up really rounding out just fine. I wouldn't give this place any awards, but I definitely wouldn't mind dining there again.

I have literally an entire second serving of Pad Thai that I had leftover...can't wait to eat it.
author: Chris S.

description:
8/29/18 Update: My co-worker who ate most of the "catfish" told me she was up all night with the hershey squirts and called in sick. Knocking it down from 3 stars to 2 stars. 
*********************************
I love people who are sarcastic and have a sense of humor. For instance, take the manager/owner (?) of Bai Thong Thai...

My co-worker and I ordered the #60 Spicy Catfish w/ basil, kaffir lime leaf, red bell pepper, red curry paste, crispy basil ($16) and received this: https://bit.ly/2MBoG3b

Me: "Hmmm, is this the right dish...it's all eggplant?"
Co-worker *walks up and grabs menu*: "Ummm, this can't be the right dish...the menu doesn't say anything about eggplant."

*Waves down server*

Co-worker: "Excuse me, we ordered the #60 Spicy Catfish, this is eggplant."
Kind server: "Ohhh, ummm, yea it comes with eggplant."

Co-worker: "But your menu doesn't state 'eggplant' and we already ordered an eggplant dish."
Kind server: "Hold on, let me ask."

Manager/Owner (?): "Yes?"
Co-worker: "We ordered the #60 Spicy Catfish and this is eggplant."

Manager/Owner: "There's fish in there, look..."
Co-worker *digs through plate*: "Ummm, 1, 2....5 fish nuggets?"

Manager/Owner *Big cheesy smile*: "Yes...SEE you get fish....AND you get the eggplant for FREE! No charge!" 
Co-worker and I: ( -- ___ -- )
(My coworker was not amused but I was hella loling inside, the manager/owner got jokes.)

*Starts eating*

Me: "Ummm, this looks and tastes like Basa."
Co-worker: "Well, it's definitely not fresh...like it came out of a frozen bag with freezer burn."

*One hour later*

Me *squeezing butt cheeks and racing to the nearest restroom*

Yep, it was definitely Basa.

(As a side note: Bai Thong Thai serves mediocre and overpriced Americanized Thai food that seems to get the overflow from Lers Ros - Hayes Valley. Nice staff but wouldn't recommend for legit Thai food.)
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
Why do I right swipe women named Felicia no matter how ancient they are, how butterface, octocatmom, ratchet af, etc.??

Duh, I want to date them.

Just so when I walk away at the end I can be like BAI FELICIAAAAAA

And when I dump dzhoz over dinner, it's gotta be at the one & only Bai Felicia Thong Thai.

Nah jk.

(^_^) PAD THAI $13
Generous portion. Sweet taste, if you like that.

(-_^) SPICY CATFISH $16
Smallish portion. Ok.

I chose this place bc everyone else on my delivery app was closing. Not bad. Sawasdee ka!
author: Dan B.

description: The door was locked when we arrived on a Monday afternoon, and it caught me off guard. But I was pleasantly surprised that we were the only customers. The old ladies were very polite. My friend and I were craving rice, so I ordered Golden Chicken Fried Rice and he got himself a Bai Thong omelette. At this point, we weren't really looking for authentic Thai food. We were super hungry from all the walking! I need to come back and try their Thai dishes such as pad kra pao, pad kee mao, etc.
author: Paolo B.

description:
I love this place... I am not sure what all your guys' deals are.

The food is fantastically flavorful, the restaurant vibe is authentic and pleasant.. and the hard-working women who run FOH are so kind.

We have ordered from here a couple times and keep coming back.

At first the reviews deterred me from wanting to try (I mean... Yelp Elites think in star-ratings) but I am happy my coworker said "just try it".

Yum. Thank you for your hard work and delicious food.
Just your service alone and attention to detail with our order being always correct/well packed sets you apart!
author: Christine S.

description: I love this place. I come here for dinner before I go to work and order their young coconut prawn curry with jasmine white write every time. When I'm with someone else ordering, I usually get the pad see ew with shrimp. They cook with authentic flavors and ingredients that I've never experienced at any other Thai restaurant. The employees are polite and very sweet and super courteous. I suggest this place to everyone who asks me in the area.
author: Jamie Z.

description: FWIW, I would have give zero stars. Was waiting to be seated for 5 mins. Despite seeing me multiple times and the establishment to be practically empty, the host ignored to acknowledge my presence. So, I left the establishment.
author: Raj D.

description:
I came here last night because I work across the street. Someone upstairs must have been cooking food, and I mistakenly thought the delicious smell was coming from Bai Thong. 

The service was great, our waitress was very kind and funny. With the being said, the food was mediocre and extremely over priced just because it's in Hayes Valley. The pad Thai was very syrupy and the curry was so sweet! 

I feel like everything came out of a box, it's wasn't authentic and it sure didn't taste healthy (so many added sweeteners :( not good...)
author: Amber L.

description:
!!!!!!Service sucks!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Got up to the front desk 3 times 
 Once to order, once to the table, once to pay. Like 2 parties here and the rest of the room is empty. What could the waitress  possibly doing in the back that causes her not to provide customer services when needed??? 
 Food ratings:
Chicken satay 3.5/5
Pad thai 3/5
Tom soup 2/5  
$40 in total for mediocre quality. Do your wallet a favor and avoid this place.
author: Carleen C.

description:
Very authentic Thai food. Not pretentious unlike a lot of the restaurants in the area. May look a little dated but honestly, if you've ever been to Bangkok or Phuket, it'll bring back memories. They even have photos of King Bhumibol up on the wall! That's really authentic Thai decor.

Had the drunken noodles and Tom Yum soup. Both were yummy. Also had the fried banana with coconut ice cream. Really good.
author: Chris F.

description:
Dropped in here because my companion and I were too hungry to walk any further, but now I wish we would've kept going. 

Health inspection warning aside, I foolishly thought maybe the resturant had improved since the slew of critical Yelp reviews, but upon the food arriving I realized just how wrong I was.

The two entrees we ordered were the pad see ew with chicken and spicy string beans with pork. The pad see ew was soggy; the noodles were in disintegrated piles over the plate (you can see for yourself in the pictures below.) And look - I know better than to expect five-star plating, but in this case the unappealing presentation belied the actual quality. The broccoli was undercooked and bland, with the chicken being heavily underseasoned (for some reason the piling of woefully sweet sauce on top didn't do anything for it upon biting down.) 

The spicy string bean with pork was the real disappointment of the night, though. Even though the menu boasted the little red chili that's supposed to indicate spiciness, the actual dish was heavily sweet, consisting of more ginger and garlic than actual chili. In fact, the only evidence of "spice" I found were the red flakes floating sadly on top of the greasy soup of sauce like they had something to prove. The pork was in dry, thin strips, tasting of mostly sawdust, and the beans were as waxy as a raw candle. 

My companion even pointed out that their water had been poured to them lukewarm, barely even cold. Good God. If you can't even get the temperature of the water right, then consider exploring a different career path.

We left disappointed, without finishing either plate or with a doggy bag. Wouldn't consider coming back within my lifetime, unless the food quality magically improves and the chef learns to take criticism. At least the service wasn't god awful, but if the only positive thing to say is "this part wasn't terrible" then there's quite obviously something wrong.

Word of advice: trust the reviews. (And that includes this one.)
author: Nin K.

description: Nice enough interior...but the food is lacking something and the staff don't seem to care. I ordered the tom kha soup with tofu and there was something missing, it was like someone had just poured a can of watered down coconut milk into a bowl. I usually clean my plate but I felt like I was going to throw up if I tried to eat it all. The appetizers came long after our soup.  Mine came so late that I had already asked for the check with the appetizer removed, so I sent it back. Bathroom was messy with no seat covers in the dispenser and the hand soap was watered down dish soap.  Come on, you can buy hand soap at the dollar store. They're not even trying here and I'm not coming back again.
author: Joanna B.

description: we ordered chicken pad see ew, duck noodle soup, and shrimp tom yum.  The pad see ew was decent, kids ate it up, but the noodle soup and the tom yum soup were just plain salty. The noodle soup portion was huge, so that's pretty generous, that's all I can say.  Service was ok.  This is in comparison to the food we've had at Lers Ros and the old Ruen Pair plus 1001 thai restaurants down in Los Angeles......
author: idlehouse i.

description: Maybe it was because it was Pride weekend, or because it was a summer Sunday, but they definitely were not prepared to have a lot of customers. Not even all of the tables were full in this modestly sized restaurant, but we had to be seated after 5 minutes by the bus boy, grab our own menus, order at the pay counter because there was no server in sight, and wait to get napkins & silverware after getting our food. We saw the server (assuming the woman who delivered our food was she) for maybe 10 seconds. And then there was a confusion with what exactly we ordered and we're going to pay for. Overpriced, understaffed.
author: Meaghan M.

description: Great fresh spring rolls with awesome peanut sauce. Iced Thai tea and Thai iced coffee were delicious - perfect amount of sweetness. Yellow curry and bbq pork dish were meh. Curry bland and dipping sauce for pork had a very distinctive taste. I'd go back for spring rolls and drinks.
author: Meenear S.

description: So far this place has been a hit or miss for me. I normally get take out here. The other night i had the best drunken noodles ever, but when I ordered them again they were not that good. I also got duck with them and it was SUPER fatty. I don't mind fatty meats, but when it is the whole piece I don't really want to eat it. They also got my friends order wrong. She asked for the curry noodles and got regular curry.
author: Amanda S.

description: 76 out of 100 health inspection rating. Wish I had seen that before ordering because I'm pretty sure this food made my stomach "busy". Wasn't right for 3 days. Came back out of desperation and while I was ordering, I saw gross looking curry batches in the fridge behind the register. They're not even hiding it. I canceled my order and left. Not worth risking my stomach again.
author: Elise H.

description: I was shocked to see some of the reviews.  I have ordered from this place a couple of times and the food is always piping hot and fresh.  The food isn't bogged down in oil like a lot of other Thai places I have been to here in SF.  The food always arrives pretty fast---although I will say I live just down the street.  So, yeah I'll be back as long as I keep getting fresh, hot, tasty Thai food!
author: James E.

description: Service sucks. Went there waiter had us wait at least 25 minutes before our order was even taken. We asked many times of the waiter to take our order the second time she said she wanted to fix the tables for a big party first so we let her do it. Then we saw her taking the orders of that party before us when we had been sitting there. We asked her again this time she gave us attitude and said "cant you guys wait I have so many things to do" this did it for us, we got up to leave. As we were leaving they said oh now we are ready to take your order. Screw that! We left and ate at another place. In an area where there are so many choices of places to eat they should vastly improve customer service!!! I'm never going there again and also spreading the word around Civic Center so great job folks!
author: Jamie S.

description:
Lers Ros was closed due to a hood filter cleaning so we went to the next closest Thai place. BIG MISTAKE.

Same prices as Lers Ros, waaaaay crappier food, and somehow, even worse customer service. Ya'll already know I think Lers Rude's service sucks, but this place is slow and when they do bring out the food...

The three of us ordered lunch and my mates got Pad Thai, and I got the Red Panang Curry. We noted that the food tasted old (not using fresh ingredients) and the tofu pieces were hard. The vegetables in their Pad Thai and my curry tasted terrible. Flavors were there but nowhere near as tasty as Lers Ros.

Edible, but nasty. DON'T GO HERE.
author: Michelle N.

description: This is our go to Thai neighborhood spot. The pick up orders are quick usually 15-20 minutes. We recommend the pumpkin curry and pad see ew. The food gets the job done.
author: Pam M.

description:
PLEASE BELIEVE THE  1 star YELP REVIEWS:

Never again.

We were in a rush today and ate lunch there instead of our usual spot, Lers Roi. Big mistake. The restaurant was completely empty at 1 pm, which should have been a clue. The food was lackluster but worst of all was the surly and downright rude service. The place was freezing and when I mentioned it to the lady she seemed upset that I had said anything.It went downhill from there and we left as soon as we were done and vowed to never come back, even in desperation.

 I truly don't understand how they can continue to stay open. I am in the neighborhood on a regular basis and would not be surprised if the place were to go out of  business soon. My husband and I were sitting there in amazement, trying to figure how are they able to pay the rent with such mediocre food, terrible service, and lack of customers.
author: parissa s.

description:
GAVE ME FOOD POISONING!!!! 
COMPLETELY OVERPRICED, DANGEROUS FOR YOUR HEALTH, THE WORST CUSOMER SERVICE!!!
I should have suspected something wrong, finding this restaurant COMPLETELY empty on a Thursday evening, dinner time, in a neighborhood bursting with the restaurant business and foot traffic. 
Now I understand why, the worst customer service I have ever encountered in this city: after they served me something I did not order, they refused to acknowledge their mistake, insisting that is what I ordered. After arguing for 30 mins and being cussed out by the cook/manager/the wife of the owner I am sure (no hired employee would have the nerve to have so much aggressive attitude towards their customers) she finally pretended to make what I was not just asking for but specifically pointed to on the menu when ordering. It was half the portion, uncooked (she just threw the sauce on to make it look like she cooked it) and I started suffering from food poisoning at night ( I will spare you the details). 
I wish I could give no starts at all!!!!
author: FREEDOM N.

description:
Feeling like you love the world after yoga? Like you should go meander into a random restaurant, instead of trusting Yelp for 4+ stars in SF?

WRONG MOVE.

This place wasn't good at all. I'd rather stay hungry instead of dining here again. I was trying to introduce my friend to Khao soi and I'm so sad that it was his first experience with the dish.

There are way better options in SF. Be a little weary of your post-yoga high when selecting a place to eat.
author: Linda N.

description: Bai Thong Thai restaurant... use to be the best place for lunch.  Today (6/30/17), when I walked in with my colleague the floor was sticky... as if the mop used wasn't clean.  That's a red flag right there!  If you don't have a clean floor, how sanitary is this place? The rice was burned and the silverware was greasy.  Bai Thong Thai restaurant have new owners and it shows.. the quality of service and uncleanliness leads to customers getting sick.  I won't be back!
author: Lynnette W.

description:
I cannot say enough about this Thai restaurant, we eat there twice a week for the past 5 years, the place is incredible.

Few facts.

1.  Menu and food is alway great, never a complaint to date!

2.  Service staff has alway been great, sometimes you might wait for water, but 99% of time the service is spot on.

I would highly recommend this place for lunch and dinner, as a East Coast transplant, give Bai Thong 6 Stars if possible!

John, Family & Friends
author: John P.

description:
I like the atmosphere i love the colors inside and the decoration the lanterns the service .This place is clean well iluminated , the bathroom  need a little help , specially the floor anyways now the food , soup pirtions enough for 2 
Soup was tasty with intense coconut flavor ,  fried rice was ok and my duck was spicy colorful delicious overall it was a good experience , try it!
author: Janet V.

description:
Decent Thai food, BUT not the best!

Their Tom Yum Gong was not spazzing with full on flavor, BUT it was still good.  The portion of soup was, in my opinion, was small for its pricing, BUT they could have made the soup base bigger!

I asked for jalapeño pieces for the rice entree, BUT it wasn't those mini slices that I preferred!

Service and ambiance was aye okay, BUT not the greatest!

I have had, BUT better Thai food!
author: Tiffany D.

description: Terrible sanitary condition! Lip stick left on the glass and hair in the soup. Will NEVER come back again!!
author: Ying L.

description: The food and service here are always good.  Quality ingredients and service with a smile can be hard to find, but Bai Thong gets it right. I recommend the panang curry.
author: crystal l.

description: Great BBQ pork dinner and the rice was just right. Oh and the sweet n sour sauce was amazing. A great hole in the wall, my girlfriend and I stumbled upon this place after going to the lion king musical. I'm not big on Thai food but this place did not disappoint, service was good and the decorations made you feel at home.
author: Danny C.

description: Nice place. Polite service. Great prices for the quality of food. Tasty and well decorated and close to the opera. The food was fresh and yummy but could have been spicier. It was quite mild. Perhaps you could ask them to make it spicy?  We had the fresh rolls with shrimp, the coconut lemongrass soup and spivey eggplant.  It was all great.
author: Ginny B.

description:
This is a solid Thai place, with good food and good service. We come here whenever we want Thai food and are in Hayes (which is relatively often), and have always had a pleasant experience. I'm pretty sure it's cheaper than Ler Ros, we went on Sunday night and spent a total of $80 including tax and tip for three of us, and that was with 2 appetizers, drinks for each of us plus our entrees and we all got our own side of rice. And they sell loose leaf thai tea! I love thai tea, and couldn't be happier about that - it was $3 for half a sandwich bag's worth, and they buy it in bulk and resell it so it does come in a sandwich bag.

It's sad to see the poor reviews, because that has definitely not been my experience here. It's not Ler Ros, so you shouldn't come here expecting it to be. And while it may not be the best Thai food you've ever had, the food is good and the people who work here are very kind.
author: Kristen D.

description: I used to love getting tom Ka soup from this place. Then they changed the size of the soup to a smaller amount for the same price. Also the soup doesn't taste as good as it used to, it has no flavor at all. The rice from my last order was either undercooked or old. I am disappointed because I used to order from here ever two weeks. I let them know about my disappointment and how I couldn't eat the dinner I just paid for. I received a polite response, but nothing was offered to redeem my business.
author: maxine b.

description: Never had a disappointment experience here. The food comes fast, nice service and much better environment then other Thai restaurants around here. Don't know who are the people complaining. This is a local jam for people who like just right Thai food.
author: Mido L.

description:
Solid Thai place near Hayes Valley.

The service has been a little bit hit or miss on the 5+ occasions I've visited, but more of the 'forgot a thing' vs rude variety so I can live with that.

I usually get the pad Thai with tofu, and the portions are big enough for me to make it one big meal or two reasonable ones.  

Great Thai iced tea, I sometimes pop in on my lunch for a sugar/caffeine infusion.  Gotta actually do lunch there sometime!
author: Amy M.

description: I was pleasantly surprised. The food was pretty decent and the wine glasses are pretty generous. Went here before the symphony and it's so conviently close. I will definitely be back!
author: Joseph C.

description:
I just don't even know how to put this. 

First, I go here almost every week because I'm too lazy to look for another place / walk more than a block.

Second, there's no one ever in there but the service is consistently unsteady. The tables are questionably clean, the decor is some bootleg-Disney version of It's A Small World. 

On to the food. Overpriced. Not good. It's just so sad because usually Thai food is consistently awesome. The food gets to the table - simple Thai staples - and you're just like "How? How did you F this up?"

It's just sad, really. I wish there was a better casual restaurant here. I wish I wasn't so lazy. But, alas, this works in a pinch, or if you're just too lazy to go somewhere new.
author: Matt D.

description:
Dreadful service. Had to ask the waitress to bring plates, water, drinks, fix our order twice, bowls... it was rough. Language barriers...

Food is mediocre at best.
author: Alex S.

description: Good, reliable Thai place that consistently satisfies. Great chicken satay and awesome fried prawns. My go-to dish is the golden chicken fried rice.
author: Sean B.

description:
There is a sign in the window asking patrons to boycott Yelp, claiming Yelp bullied people and kept them from writing good reviews. I thought that was odd; I 've been "yelping" for years and never been censored, and the reason I tried Bai Thong Thai was because of good reviews on Yelp. So if i give it 2 stars, it's not because Yelp "bullied" me, it's because they deserved it.

I had a 5 PM dinner reservation; when they open. There was one couple ahead of me, who were seated by a window. There were several small tables available by windows, which are considered the better seats, but I was seated interior. It's not a huge deal, food is primary, and maybe I'm being over-sensitive but many places do treat solo customers, especially women, as less.

But food is primary. I ordered Angel Wing, Tom Yum soup (vegetarian) and Roast Duck over rice.

Wings were best, although not at all crispy, good taste. The soup was overwhelmingly sour. Thai food is supposed to be more balanced. But it would have been a good palate cleanser/sinus clearer between courses. Except halfway down the bowl was a huge wedge of raw, pallid, flavorless, out of season tomato. Not traditional and added nothing to the soup. Duck is a fatty meat, but has lean parts. This duck was fatty, not very flavorful, and sparse; the dish was mostly rice.

Then they brought the check without asking if I wanted dessert, a big no-no. I asked for vanilla ice cream, I had thought about coconut but figured I'd stick with the most basic thing that no one could goof up. The ice cream was in a pretty blue dish with a swirl of chocolate. It was FULL of big ice crystals. That happens when ice cream partially thaws and is re-frozen. Aside from aesthetics, it left me concerned about their food storage habits. 

Ironically, after earlier trying to hustle me out, when I did finish I had to wait a long time for check, finally had to wave the wait person down.

Find myself agreeing with Michelle N who said same prices a Lers Ros but with worse food and service.
author: Carol S.

description: Super nice people, good food, quiet and serene, reasonable prices -- loved our dinner here!
author: B K.

description: This is probably the worst restaurant that I've been to in a long time. First, I specifically said "no green onion" and the soup came up with a lot of onions atop, I didn't want to bother with them so I started picking them out one by one. The waitress watched the entire process and didn't say anything - did she forget that I said no green onion? Or did she just don't care? Then the main course never came, and the waitress just went to the other room with a glass of wine and hung out with other girls in that room. I wasn't sure what's going on so I went to that room asked her where's the main dish, and she looked astonished, went into the back and started cooking....... this is like surrealism in the form of a crappy restaurant, please don't go to this place so that it can be out of this neighbourhood fast. Seriously. Oh btw, obviously the food can't beat the terribleness of the service, but it's still pretty bad. For the sake of your sanity and health, please don't go.
author: Helen L.

description: Came to this place after watching the Lion King around the corner. A little nervous since we were out of our element, this place saved our night. We ordered barbecue pork and rice, as well as the spring soup. Perfect food for the colder weather outside. The food was amazing, the staff was really sweet. We want to go back and try the pad Thai!!
author: Emma B.

description: Excellent service and food was delicious! Definitely recommend this place! The people were very nice and pleasant. Free Wifi too!
author: Mauro C.

description: The spicy eggplant was very good. Nice atmosphere and fantastic location. Excellent service. Pairs really well with Smitten!
author: Rachel B.

description:
My favorite Thai restaurant in the area. Food is much tastier than at the nearby Lers Ros Thai, and there's almost never a wait. It's also much quieter than Lers Ros, so you can actually have a conversation.

I also really like their pineapple fried rice, which few places in SF seem to serve.
author: Greg S.

description: Back room lunch:  After too many bad experiences, I'm giving up on this place. Although it looks like a quick grab-and-go setup, there is often a long wait - for pretty mediocre takeout.  Service is slow, disorganized, and RUDE. The staffer who runs it is brusque and unpleasant - hands you food, then snatches it away, then gets snappish with customers for her mistake. There's a sign in the window telling people not to believe the negative reviews. Nope - believe them.
author: maureen p.

description: I came by myself, and I did not eat. I came in at 6:45 on a Thursday night and was waved to a table by a cheerless silent waitress. The front room was full, and I waited 10 minutes before a menu was literally thrown on my table without a word. I never got water, however all the other tables were served water and their orders were taken. I left after 20 minutes.
author: Avery C.

description:
I'm not sure why this place has an "interesting" reputation on Yelp.  The food was good. Quite good, actually, and I would go back to try other things upon my next visit.  The one thing that stood out to me for the reason behind the lack of stars was the service.

Although I didn't dine-in, I wanted to order some food to go and walked by so I checked it out. The lights were on and 2 women were behind the counter welcoming me in but the door wouldn't budge.  It turns out the door was locked.  That might have explained why there were no other guests inside.  Either they locked up early and decided to let me in to order or they had left the doors locked all day and didn't realize it.  Hmmm....

I was given water while I waited which was nice and the check came to pay for my take-out order.  I decided not to leave a tip as I usually do if I'm picking up the food myself since the payment is for the price of food, and there was no service given.  I noticed a change in one of the women's demeanor after that moment.  The food was yelled out "Your order is ready!" as I was just sitting at the table directly in front of the counter.  I don't think the yell was necessary, and why wasnt the water called out when it was ready?  I could've easily walked to the counter to grab that as well.

All-in-all the food was tasty.  I might not choose to dine-in next time seeing as how the restaurant didn't strike me as a place to spend my time, but the food is worth a second chance.
author: Kevin J.

description: We got pineapple fried rice and pad thai... Both of them were mediocre. Fried rice was a bit too greasy and blend (could have been better if they used more spices), and pad thai was just okay... I ate here because someone recommended me over Ler Los, but my experience at Ler Los was better so far. Perhaps I should try different dish next time.
author: Ella K.

description:
I really like this place. 
It's often very quiet but they do a brisk to-go business. 
I've always  enjoyed the food and the servers are sweet. 
There was another Thai restaurant in the same location years ago which wasn't as good, and I think they may be having a rough time recovering from that business's inferior food, but these guys are great. 
It's not super-duper but the prices reflect that. If you want fancy-schmancy, go to Lers Ros a couple blocks away, but this is delicious and the service is good.
author: Autumn A.

description:
We were hungry and decided to give this place a second chance as our first experience was not so good...
This time service was a bit slow but the food was delicious and the young sever was nice enough.
We had the Drunk Mans Noodles, Panang tropical Curry with fresh avocado, Brown rice and the Tom Kha soup...everything was hot fresh and delicious... ($40 and a good portion of left overs) 
They are worthy now of a third try!
author: Sean M.

description:
I pegged this place at 3 stars with my first review because I had a typical Thai experience.

And then the second time I had a ratatouille moment.

Not that I've ever made spicy basil Thai myself, but somewhere in between the Dylan 60s and the 90s acoustic Train (I'm just barely an 80s baby) I was harkened back to simpler times when I first tasted basil regularly -- making spaghetti with my sisters on the flat Midwestern plain, with the gray-blue fade of the sun through the clouds on a cloudy spring day.
author: Christophe C.

description: Don't quite understand why all the negative reviewers! Bai Thong is a nice little neighborhood restaurant in Hayes Valley. Unlike all the hip, chic, busy, waiting line, over booked, to see and be seen places in Hayes Valley, this little jam is consistent in their food, good service and friendliness. Most of all, it is quiet (you can have a conversation), no waiting and no hazel just to get something to eat place.
author: Kim L.

description: Great food for a decent price. There's only so many ways you can fuckin' make Thai food. I don't understand the bad reviews. If you aren't a picky snob and like Thai food, go here if you happen to pass by. Not necessary to go out of your way, but well worth it.
author: Samuel G.

description:
Ok, let's be clear, the only reason you come here is because you have to catch a show, you have limited time to eat, and all the restaurants you want to go to around this neighborhood are packed.  Bai Thong is never packed, you can walk in anytime before showtime and get a table.  There's a reason for that.

The food here is a step above cafeteria food, some hit and some misses.  The portion is small and the price high.  The service is also hit and miss.  On a normal day when there are few people, the service is not bad; but there is no reason for you to come on a normal day.  On a busy day, like on weekends or some important premiers, this place has a lot more patrons and the staff is overwhelmed.  They are not rude but not well trained - I saw plenty of mixing up checks, bringing food to the wrong table, forgetting things, ignoring customers because they are so busy, etc.  Every mistake means they have to spend more time fixing the mistake and it just pile on to the point where they are just scrambling.  If you have to come here on a busy day, my advice is to be proactive and grab the attention of the staff and be prepared to flag them down several times before they come.

Now, with that said. This is not a complaint - I like them for exactly what they are and I DO NOT want Bai Thong to change anything.   There is a reason that you can always find a table at this joint when every restaurant around there is packed to the sidewalk - it's because enough people decide that, "Oh screw it!  I would rather starve than go to Bai Thong!"; that I could get a table and I don't starve.  

This is the last restaurant you should go to in this part of the city but that's exactly why Bai Thong deserves three stars for those times when you have to eat, can't wait, and don't mind paying a lot for mediocrity.   
.
author: Unai L.

description:
Awesome food!! 

Chicken satay, delicious. Must have!! 
Drunken noodles is spicy but hit the spot!
Pumpkin curry was a bit lackluster. Pumpkin had no flavor, curry was bland, and it was watery. 

Pad see-ew c'mon now, you know that's an easy one, of course, they did great!

Good service. Super friendly. 

Handicap accessible!  (I had a wheelchair, post-op.) 

Prices are reasonable!
author: Fannie S.

description: unfortunately I have gotten food poisoning from the food here.... twice. I thought the first time was a fluke, but it happened again recently.
author: Christine W.

description: After reading some of the reviews I was hesitant to eat here but I'm so glad I took the chance and I learned that yelp lies. I ordered the emerald fried rice and my significant other ordered the curried duck. Both were absolutely delicious. The atmosphere was great. Service was okay. I will be coming back here :)
author: Summer D.

description: I had a much more pleasant experience than many other reviewers! I was there at 6pm on a Thursday and the place was almost empty. The lady behind these counter was very friendly and recommended the pumpkin curry. Though a tad pricey (though perfectly normal for SF), it was delicious and I would have had leftovers if I hadn't been so hungry. I got my order to go but she quickly offered me a glass of water while I waited. The dish came out very quickly and was so good - everything cooked perfectly. It might be my new regular lunch spot!
author: Taylor H.

description: Delicious healthy food, gracious service, lovely atmosphere with windows for people-watching the Hayes Valley crowd. The brown rice is a mixture of red & brown rice in a heart-shaped form - romantic & tasty. Try the Thai Twister if you love eggplant & green beans. It's perfect!
author: Maureen P.

description: Sorry guys. Ate here years ago and it was good. Ordered Larb Chicken last week for lunch and I could barely get down one bite.  Smell was foul. I hope the homeless person I gave it to survived.
author: Dean P.

description:
We recently moved to the area and we're looking for a good Thai place to visit regularly. Unfortunately, this won't be it. The service was extremely slow-- there were only two other tables in the restaurant and it took us a solid ten minutes to get water or menus. More importantly, the food really just wasn't good. All of the vegetables were overcooked, and I'm going to give the kitchen the benefit of the doubt and say they were boiled, but they just as well could have been cooked in a microwave. The pad Thai was sickeningly sweet, and the Thai iced tea was even sweeter. The red curry saved this from being a one star review, as the sauce was helpful in distracting from the limp zucchini and string beans.

Interestingly, this place has a sign in their window crying foul at Yelp, claiming their reviews are being censored. To the owner-- I'd suggest spending less time blaming others and more time focusing on what you can do to improve your establishment.
author: Abe S.

description: This place is awful, service is absolutely terrible.  Don't waste your time. Did not bring half our order even though we reminded them about it twice. One in our party literally left without eating anything.  The worst part is they acted as if they did not get the order but yet they billed us for it. Many other Thai places in the city so no need to  go to this one.
author: David H.

description:
**This review is only for their samosas**

Flaky and delicious!!!
author: Linda N.

description:
1.0 star rating 11/15/2016
The meal I ate at Bai Thong on Nov. 15th was excruciatingly bad.  Their special cold spring rolls were tasteless and wrapped so poorly that they fell apart almost at once.  The crispy chicken fried rice was inedible, the chicken so rubbery that even if I had a knife I could not have cut it.  Strong teeth could not penetrate it.  When I complained to the server, she seemed not to understand a word.  No apologies were offered, no adjustment was made to the bill.  I'd never go back there.  San Francisco is full of Thai restaurants.  I have had decent meals at this one in the past, though the service is often slow and inattentive.  This last meal, however, was so disastrous I would not risk a return.
author: Peter W.

description: Got my order wrong, and food disgusting. I asked for grilled, they gave me fried. And it's entirely fried, like something out of the Iowa State Fair. Disgusting. And was supposed to come with a fried egg? No fried egg. Jfc.
author: B H.

description:
Very quiet and intimate place to eat. went during the day and there were about 3 or 4 other tables occupied, which makes it good for day dates or even first dates.

I wish the thai ice tea was bigger but that's just me.

Pad thai Bai Thong special was good, just regret mixing my bean sprouts in that they put on the side, because then it was too much bean sprout.

They serve the pad thai with fresh peanuts, my favorite in pad thai.  Overall, pretty good. But what made it a really enjoyable experience was the walls and the decorations.  Love love love the look of the place.
author: Hazel K.

description: I am writing this as I am walking out of the restaurant followed by six other tables. I've never walked out of a restaurant before in my life but after waiting very patiently for over an hour my party wasn't able to get any food or drink refills and the waitresses were nowhere to be found. I think that they were having issues with the wait staff or the kitchen but we couldn't get any answers. I noticed on the way out the door they had a very low health score which given the level of service we received didn't surprise me. We ended up being late for a nearby show because of how long we waited. I would not be surprised to see this place closed in a month. You can't handle prime time on a Saturday night in downtown you will go under.
author: Steven P.

description: Love this spot - had a big family get together last night and everything was delish ! Service great and decor is beautiful
author: Gallagher G.

description:
Poor service and lack luster food!
Decided to pick this place because it is more quiet than nearby les Roos,
Bad idea.... Ordered beer with 3 glasses, the waiter did not even pour it for us (we were first to arrive, so it was not busy) then the coconut soup witch they again did not serve! It was not hot and very sweet, not to mention a small portion. The prices here are not cheap here either. The rest of the meal was mediocre, would not go here again. They are closing soon anyway so it won't be a great loss to the nieghborhood.
author: K. K.

description: Delicious food, prompt and gracious service, and surrounded by good, interesting art. All at reasonable prices (especially for the "new" Hayes Valley. I've been coming here for years and hope to keep coming for a long time.
author: Ken K.

description: Asked for egg noodle soup they gave ramen from the package and charge $12! Wtf? I could have done it at home.  I vowed not to come here again but I did only to find an ogre lady maybe the owner giving me dirty looks because I used the restroom before ordering.  Then while I was eating she was still giving me dirty looks.  Don't order the soup but the rice plates and curry is good.  Overpriced but in this neighborhood everything is.
author: Chris S.

description: Came here for a quick bite after attending a performance at a nearby venue. Service was quick, but the waitress had trouble understanding us. Spouse wanted to know if he could get pad thai made vegan, and she nodded, but further questions seemed to reveal she didn't really understand what "vegan" meant. However, he persisted and repeated "no egg, no dairy, no shrimp, no fish, no animal at all" - and he did get vegan pad thai. He rated it mediocre. For my part, I had duck noodle soup which was quite tasty. My appetizer of samosas was more like Chinese-style curry dumplings (with a thick, sweetish dough) than the Indian appetizer I think of when I hear "samosa." But they were tasty as well.
author: D. R. G.

description: Enjoyed Bai Thong Thai a couple of times.  Always ordered food 'extra spicy' and that ranges from bland to insanely spicy.  When visiting the restaurant, the service is alway impeccable and the facilities are clean.  Food is always fresh.
author: Patrick T.

description:
This place is phenomenal. 
I'm confused why there aren't more stars and the place isn't packed more often.
Everything I have gotten has been awesome.
My favorites are the Giants soup-  a coconut lemongrass soup with pumpkin. We get it with shrimp. Omg. Literally the soup that fixes all ailments. When my bf is sick I bring him this everytime.
Another favorite is the Tropical curry. It's panang curry with either mango or avocado. Deelish. 

Great quiet spot. Wonderful regular staff.
You won't regret it!
author: Octavia H.

description: This place was alright - I tried a few different items and they ranged from mediocre to good.  The Pumpkin Curry had the perfect flavor for the sauce, but the meat itself was tasteless.  The Samosas were okay - I enjoyed the filling, which was better than the pastry.  For dessert we shared Mango Sticky Rice, which was pretty good and the Fried Banana Rolls were okay.
author: Ken G.

description:
Average. Not great, not bad. Just ok. Fast and friendly to-go from the back area only.

For $7 lunch that includes a drink, I'd go back (but only for the Pad See Ew - which was super garlicky and tasty. Texture of the noodle wasn't great, but not bad either, but  I still destroyed that to-go container.)

The runny yellow curry with smushy rice was blah. This is what I get for trying to be adventurous.
author: Donna H.

description: Solid Thai food, good value, and very filling.  It's a good go-to if you're in the mood for a tasty bite without having to fork over the cash like other restaurants in the neighborhood.   Ambiance is what you'd expect from a lower priced Thai place, but servers are nice, and the tunes are usually bumpin'.
author: Keelee W.

description: We never actually tasted the food because it took them so long. They took ten minutes before they even gave us the menu then another ten to take our order. We eventually got up and left after forty five minutes and no food in sight. We weren't the only ones that did this either. Their service is terrible and half of the people there that night weren't able to taste the food.
author: Lucy O.

description: I ordered a steamed rice. The female waitress with glasses brought it to me. I noticed a black thing on rice and told her right away before she put it down. Guess what she did.  She used her own fingers to pikc it up from the rice plate in front of me.  OMG.  Never again.
author: J C.

description: Ordered the hot and sour soup for delivery because I was visiting a friend who lived nearby. I paid $3 for extra vegetables in my soup and got no such thing. The soup was incredibly salty and I could barely eat it. Very disappointed and feel like I should receive a refund for the extra veggies.
author: Katie S.

description:
Several months ago I walked by and saw a sign in the window where they were moaning about Yelp bullies and bad reviews.   I sort of felt bad for them, and wondered if it was all true.

Last night 3 of us were ravenous.  We went to all the usual spots in Hayes Valley but the wait was going to be an hour.  We'd walked past Bai Thong and had seen open tables so we went back.

I cannot eat sugar
I cannot eat soy

For some reason this can be challenging for a lot of restaurants.  But I'm polite.  Very polite.  And I'm open to suggestions.    

Aren't the basics of Thai cooking coconut milk, lemongrass, and herbs?  Can't they get a bit creative and skip the sugar and soy?  

When I politely told the waitress what I cannot eat she looked at me like having to serve me was the worst thing to have ever happened in her life.  She went back to the kitchen three times and three times told me that everything was already prepared and soy/sugar mixed in.

Each time she was gone we heard the beep beep beep of their MICROWAVE.  

On her last return she said that all they could do for me was steamed chicken and steamed vegetables.  With my stomach roaring I said "ok"   Assuming that their "chef" would never prepare and serve something so dull and would spice things up.

Wrong.

My friend's food arrived on big platters (portions are stupidly big) and glistening of oil and sugar.  Mine arrived  on a small square plate with 3 steamed vegetables (and they have many others which we saw on other dinner's plates) and chicken as dry as a stick.  I kid you not.  Not a drop of moisture to the chicken, just shriveled wizened pieces of tasteless factory chicken.

They had the nerve to charge me over $10 for insult.  I ate only enough to make the hunger settle down.

Waitress never came by to ask how everything was.  She never refilled water or tea.  We had to ask three times for the check.  And needless to say, they were not that busy on a Saturday night where every GOOD restaurant in the area was jammed with people going to the Opera or Symphony.
author: Cinnamon Z.

description:
Frustrating encounter whereby acceptable, casual, affordable Thai food became tainted by poor execution, questionable service, and a mediocre dining experience. 

Came here with my husband and two friends for a casual Saturday night dine-in. Location and menu looked great. Our orders were placed and taken down quickly. But there was a real time management problem in the kitchen. We ordered within 5 minutes of being seated, but somehow it took 15 minutes just to get waters on the table, 25-30 minutes for the first dish to be served, and another (awkward) half hour or so before the other entrees made it out for the rest of our group. We had to beg our friend who received his food so far ahead of the rest of us to eat, or I'm certain it would have gone cold. When the check was handed to us (the correct version--they had initially overcharged us for an entree), we asked to split the check three ways, which they refused to do for some incoherent reason. This was particularly obnoxious, since they have a sign displayed in clear view which says that checks can be split up to FOUR ways. But, after spending nearly two hours (mostly waiting) here, we just wanted to get away, and figured out another division of payment. 

The food here is okay, but the service isn't acceptable. Two other patrons seated nearby were not willing to wait as we did, and threatened to leave or actually left out of frustration over the same time management issues we encountered. Find another regular spot!
author: Lauren T.

description:
Decent thai food-- tried the mango panang curry and the basil tofu dish.

Mango Panang- The highlight of the meal. The fresh mango on top was absolutely delicious (could've eaten it without the curry but dipped in the curry was even better). The curry was light yet still rich and all the vegetables inside made it a very filling meal, easily split into two portions. Even though $13 is more than I would expect for a place like this, the curry was so good it was worth every penny. 

Basil Tofu- very average basil tofu dish. I liked the sauce it was cooked in, but not enough to pay $10 for it plus the cost of rice. 

Roommate tried the tomyum soup which she liked and also was a big serving size, but again for $14 which is quite a bit for soup. 

Verdict: For looking like a very regular thai restaurant (no extra embellishments in service or ambiance), it was too pricey. My roommates and I paid $50 for dinner when I could likely get the same priced food at a nicer restaurant with better ambiance in the city (ex Lers Ros nearby. Probably won't be returning due to the high prices that I can't justify.
author: Anu P.

description: I really want to love this place since it's located in Hayes Valley and so close to the Opera House and The Symphony Hall. We came in as a group of 20 after my sister's graduation since I had made a reservation for this place a few weeks beforehand. We were seated in the back room and also did my order online to make things easier for them.  We started out with the duck salad, a beer tower, and two bottles of Pinot.  When we came into the restaurant it was quite empty for Mother's Day yet they were slow at getting us our drinks.  Of course we know we had a big group however they should've been a little more prepared since they knew we were coming.  I knew they were busy therefore I assisted in pouring the drinks for my family and was extremely patient with the service.  Next came our curry dish however only one came and we ordered three therefore we had to continuously play the waiting game for food.  Our beer tower emptied rather quickly and we asked for another beer tower and that took over 15 minutes before they were able to get it to our table. Then came the pad see ew, pineapple fried rice, eggplant with tofu and basil, and the sweet and sour fish.  The food was flavorful and fantastic however the service was too slow for our liking.  I really wanted to like this place and I will definitely come back and hopefully they will have their service issues fixed.  Come for the great food but don't expect top notch service.
author: Sharon N.

description:
Decent thai food for lunch never been there for dinner. Price wise is comparable to other places in the area...not cheap but not that expensive. the sit down side actually deserves 3 stars. The take out place is more like 1.5.

During the lunch time during the week day they offer the lunch box special which is a little cheaper, not as tasty. I think their target audience are the high schooler next door. Basically its premade, you have three options, pick one of the three and pay cash. When the owner is working the register, I always feel a little bit screwed because she'll find a reason to charge me a dollar more, even tho the person ahead of me ordered the same thing. One she short changed me. I gave her a $20, for a $7 meal....my change was three dollars. When i told her she laughed it off and said how tired she was.  There's an underlying bitchy-ness to that fake smile of hers. Watch out for that one! I only keep going because I can get a quick to go lunch when I'm short on time.

The rest of the workers are alright.
author: tee c.

description:
First off the food there is so amazing I probably eat there twice a week at least. The staff there are so sweet and attentive . Dining there feels like a fun time with friends. 
Oh Bai Thong, you have my heart. xo
author: Chelsea T.

description: Nice, decent and tasteful thai-food. The service and waiters were so nice and attentive! We had a concert at the SF jazz and center and had to eat in 25 minutes, but the food came quickly which was great! The samosas were good and the rice noodles with chicken was good as well!
author: Emma K.

description:
I live nearby and eat in or take out quite often. 

It is cheap, food is consistently tasty and the service is very good. Never had a bad experience with them. They only have pretty traditional american thai food on the menu and cheap furniture, which is perfectly fine with me, so it's not overpriced mediocre thai-ish stuff like in Osha. 
Glad to give them 5 stars
author: Anjelika P.

description:
I'm STILL irritated. Very, VERY disappointed, & IRRITATED.

I needed to make a trip to Walgreens, & my growling stomach reminded me that I'd been planning to see what this spot had to offer.  Me & Da Kid go in, & are seated immediately.  There were only two other dine-in customers...why did it take 15 minutes to get water? Then another 15 for her to come back & take the order? 

We attempted to order the giant wings, but were told (10 minutes later) that they were out for the evening. My son then orders the sweet & sour red snapper, & the pad see-ew with chicken for me.  My son's food comes out pretty promptly; it was fresh & flavorful (thus, the two stars). However, I'm sitting there foodless; this doesn't make any sense to me, as I'm waiting on noodles...how does the fried fish dish come before mine? I wait another 5 minutes or so before flagging the waitress down & asking her if my food was still being prepared...come to find out she didn't order it.  So, it's ANOTHER 10 minutes for my food to come out. Once it does, I'm wondering if they'd mistakenly added sugar...it was ickily sweet, with NO savory; this isn't what I'm used to.   The portion sizes definitely don't align with the expensive pricing; you don't get much food, & $14 for pad see-ew is more than Osha...hmmm...

No one bothered to check up on us during the meal; again, the spot was pretty empty & there wasn't any excuse.  My son finally got up to request the bill. What's the ENTIRE STAFF doing? Playing on their mutual cell phones, paying no attention to the floor whatsoever.  Yup, this was a one time, hit-it-and-quit-it moment...never again.
author: Amoura B.

description:
Been here before. Let's be honest yelp, this place is at least a 3.5 if not a 4 star place. End of discussion. 

Service was friendly and efficient. Food tasty and fresh. What else do you want?

Rumor is that they're editing/censoring reviews because they won't pay for yelp ads. Say it ain't so. I mean that's really douchey.
author: Zack S.

description: Others might find value in their lunch meal. I particularly ordered pho and chicken yellow curry and I thought that it was just ok and average. You be the judge! I ordered my food to go so can't really say much about the service except that when they said 15 min, it was indeed 15 min. Can't get mad at that. Perhaps I'll be back. The decor is cool and very tropical-like.
author: J C.

description:
This is the worst restaurant in Hayes Valley. I can't wait till it goes out of business. 

On my last trip here is the order of events:
- We were sat at a dirty table. 
- Then rather than clean the table, they just moved us. And never cleaned the dirty table. 
- The host failed to give us menus. 
- When we ordered, only 1/2 of our order was taken. When we finished ordering entrees the host walked away before we could order apps/drinks. 
- They appeared to be cleaning the bathroom without gloves on, then presumably not washing their hands. 
- One persons food came out almost 30 min before the others. 
- The second entree had a big black hair in it. 
- The unapologetic waitstaff just took the dish away and said they would make another. 
- We left, and went to the German restaurant with excellent service and hair free food. 
Never going back. You can risk it if you like.
author: Jason M.

description:
We were in the area and decided to give this place a try. Despite many other displeased  reviews I was pleasantly surprised! The decor is ok as was the service. We had a special asparagus dish that was cooked really well and Drunk Man noodles. They consisted of Rice noodles pan fried with tomato, mushroom, Chinese broccoli, bamboo shoots, bell pepper onion, basil, chili, with Beef.  It had just the right amount of spice that I prefer and enhances the dish. It was really good and I'd never had this dish before. 

I really liked the plating of the food and there was plenty to eat. If I'm in the area again I will come back.

.
author: Jeff C.

description:
I really, really liked this place. I was willing to overlook the abysmal service the first few times because I really liked the food and specifically I loved those banana spring rolls. 

I went here for my birthday dinner. There was only one waitress working, and in spite of there only being about 4 tables full, she seemed vastly overburdened. We ordered a bottle of wine, soup, two appetizers and dinner. 

First, my dinner came out. Then a long while later his appetizer came out, and almost immediately his dinner came out. Then my appetizers came out about 15 minutes later. We asked about the wine and they apologized, and forgot it again. Then, finally, another woman brought out a bottle of wine. We both pointed out that it was a red wine and we had ordered white. She told us that we were wrong and uncorked it anyways. She poured it into my glass and, surprise! It's red wine. She then went into the back for a while and eventually found the bottle of white we'd ordered about a thousand years ago. At that point I asked her what had happened to the soup I ordered at the beginning of the meal, and I guess they forgot? Given the order of the rest of the meal, I have no idea. 

I got my soup and there was a bug in it. I immediately picked it up, went over to the counter and quietly but politely told them that there was a bug in my soup. An older woman grabbed the soup, looked at the bug and then really rudely and loudly told me that I was wrong, it was a spice. I told her that spices typically don't have legs and wings. Then, she started arguing with me about it. I had laughed off everything else before that, trying to make the best of it, but that was my breaking point. Also? Her solution was to fish it out of the bowl with her fingers and throw it away. I walked away and back to our table because at that point I was pretty much done with the whole experience. It really sucked, and I didn't get the dessert I wanted. 

So....yeah, we'll never be back.
author: Christy S.

description: Sweet, attentive server, good lunch special, spicy Thai basil chicken, rice, fresh greens salad.
author: Matt M.

description: I love the authentic Thai tea here. You can also buy a bag to bring home for $3. I've had pad see ew (tofu, beef, and chicken) here, and the portion is more than enough for one person.
author: Fanny T.

description:
I liked this place quite a bit. Ate here 6 months ago and forgot about it - didn't remember until they started getting shafted by Yelp and good reviews not showing up (the story made it onto a few local and national newspapers this morning). 

I remember being impressed that the veggies were so fresh and the sauces so light - I hate heavy brown sauces on wilted veggies, something that is often a staple of Thai restaurants in the US.

The fact that they used real Thai eggplants and loads of garlic and basil on everything made my mouth very happy.
author: Moses H.

description:
I was inSF over the weekend and went there after reading a article in LA times.    The curry was incredible, the large pieces of white meat  with the perfect blend of carrots and potatoes made it very balanced, the spice was not too hot nor too spicy is was simply  the best Thai dish I had ever has.


I really love the Thai Tea and also my wife ordered a noodle plate and some egg rolls.  The egg Rolls were light and fluffy, not greasy like some places.
author: William K.

description:
A friend suggested this place for dinner not too long after it opened. I had my doubts but we ended up having an enjoyable dinner. All of the dishes were delicious and freshly cooked. Clean restaurant, polite service. 

I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here but it's perfect if you're in the neighborhood and have a hankering for Thai.
author: Lisa K.

description: We came here after jazz and were super hungry. Got the flat noodles with chicken,  larb, and coconut curry with brown rice as take out. The larb was average, no complaints. The flat noodles were tasty, would get them again for sure. The coconut curry was good, although I thought slightly bland. The brown rice was whole grain and yummy so that with a litte curry, a little hot pepper and salt it because perfect. service was friendly. we'd do it again.
author: Zara S.

description:
Liked it.  Fast service, good food.  Of course, I've never been to Thailand, so treat me as a novice.  But I like Thai food.

We had about 50 minutes to eat, so I've asked the waiter to bring us our dishes without even looking in the menu.  The guy  wrote everything down and we got exactly what we've ordered (Pad Thai and Red Curry w/ chicken and rice) about 15 minutes later.  

Everything tasted good, the prices were quite adequate for lower Peninsula (I'm not sure about San Francisco, maybe you should be able to find excellent Thai food for a buck per dish, I dunno).  

Yes, this place looks good for a date.  It's quite quiet, has a non-intrusive service as far as I could tell, and it's not crowded, at least on Sunday afternoon (~7PM).  Next time I have a date in San Francisco, I"m bringing her here.
author: S C.

description: Terrible. They served undercooked chicken. This place is a health hazard and does not have a competent enough staff to properly deal with the occasional mistake. Wait staff was nice, but obviously had no clue what to do to save the restaurants inept management. We waited a good 45 minutes for okay Thai food that was a bit overpriced for the quality we received.
author: Eric D.

description:
AVOID AVOID AVOID!! 
This place is the worst Thai restaurant I have been to in the city.  They should sell out to Osha or King of Thai or something immediately.  

I gave this place many chances but it is awful Thai food.  

- I once paid $20 for delivery of tom yom goong soup and white rice.  The watery soup had  a single shrimp and almost no flavor.   The shrimp looked like it had been in the back of a freezer for years.  
- Almost nobody there, empty tables, not customers every time I walk by
- Freezer bag veggies and some peanut sauce does not make good Thai food!
- They use the cheapest ingredients and skimp on everything from flavoring to portion size.
author: M S.

description: Love this place! Service is great. Pricing is decent. And the food comes out quickly. I got the pad Thai with chicken and the pirate treasure soup. Both very good.
author: Matt C.

description:
Their food was amazing. I love Thai food already but the crew at Bai Thong Thai were pleasant and very friendly. The Flavors brought me back to Thailand.
Lindsay Wood
author: Lindsay H.

description:
5/5/2013
We paid our first visit to this place because of its proximity to our destination. And, for that reason and that reason alone, we'll probably return.

The food was OK, the service not what it should be, the tab fair.
________________

We've returned several times. The food and service have gotten better. Still not worthy of recommendation because it's not exceptional but no reason to avoid it as it's quite adequate.
author: Icono C.

description:
Meh. 

The reason my friend and I ate here was that it was conveniently-located and because she knew she wouldn't run into any coworkers there.

You could do worse, but you could also do _so much better._ The food here was totally middle-of-the-road in the way that I'd expect from Thai food in a place with no access to ingredients (southern Spain, I'm looking at you.)

The prices are a little on the high side for what the food and portion sizes are. 

The Pad Thai was below average but not terrible, and the tom kha was just meh. It was about $14 for lunch per person (two of us split the above) after tax and tip. There are no condiments (hot sauce or sugar) on the tables, so that's a minus, too, especially given that most Thai places (and my understanding is that within Thai food culture generally it's the norm to) give you the ability to doctor your dishes to your liking.

Unmemorable food, unmemorable service.
author: Adriana V.

description:
I work very close to this restaurant and I really like it! There was another thai restaurant in the same location that wasn't as good, so I think they may be suffering because that one wasn't as good.
I've always been really happy with the food - the service is...amusing. Not bend over and kiss your shoes service by any means, and some days I wish the waitresses spoke more English, but all in all, they're good.
I get asked on a regular basis where people should eat in the neighborhood and I don't hesitate for a moment to recommend Bai Thong.
My favorite is the duck over spinach and my boyfriend loves their Pad See Ew.
Good food, decent prices, pleasant servers...
author: Autumn A.

description: Me and my friend grabbed a random Thai to eat. I ordered rolls and BBQ pork comes with salad. The salad part is a different taste experience for me as it mixed cilantros with mango, which taste both mild and pungent, I like it. Yet it also has many sweet sauce so taste unhealthy and flavor is not enough to make up for it. Meat part is among the average. My friend is vegetarian smelled fish sauce in her Pad Thai, but the staff is nice to replace it. Not sure it's their bad practice, make sure you remind them at beginning.
author: Yixi F.

description:
In short: great food, good service, cheap. 

The best part was that we went with 7 people without reservation and didn't have to wait to get a table. After dinner, we stayed and chatted for an hour. The waiters didn't rush us, just kept refilling our glasses with water. We had a great evening catching up with everyone. 

About the food, it was good. No complaints there. Typical american Thai food as you know it from other Thai restaurants. That means it was not mind-blowing either, but for that you'd have to go to a more expensive fancy looking place. 

Highly recommend if you just want to have some nice Thai without spending 40$ each.
author: Malin D.

description:
I'm done trying to like this place. 

I have eaten here three times and I've ordered: the pad Thai (eatable), a chicken dish with lime (it was actually tasty but it was supposed to come with a "salad"... plain lettuce drenched in the chicken juice), and the tom kha gai soup (it was disgusting!! yucky, yucky, yucky).
author: Diana G.

description:
SICK :(  
I knew the seafood in the soup tasted off. 
Luckily, it was otherwise bland so I didn't finish, or I would have missed more work to recover from this dinner assault. 

The delivery gal didn't have any change, so I ended up tipping $7 for a 2 block delivery. 

$30 for a TINY soup and SMALL veg dish.
NO rice, NO utensils, NO napkins!? WTF?!
author: yasmine k.

description: Great service, very good food, affordable prices.  Best Thai food in the neighborhood.  I hear they're closing soon. They will be missed.
author: Angela B.

description:
I was skeptical of the three-star rating, but on a mission to find some pumpkin curry (no joke). Found it here, and it was good. 

Nothing about the experience here stands out as 5 stars, but both dishes (we also ordered garlic veggies with tofu) were quite tasty. Service was fast and attentive (worked just fine for a mid-week lunch). Will go again.
author: Rob R.

description:
I remember being told about this Thai place and have been curious as I've lived in the neighborhood almost all my life and wondered if this Thai joint that's so conveniently close to me was just as good as those in the outer sunset, mission and richmond area... Those places may be far but I'd much rather trek on out that way for Thai food than go here. 

Usually I order simple dishes like Pad Thai or Pad See Ew to see if the thai place is good enough but I wasn't in the mood. I ordered the pineapple fried rice as that's also another favorite of mine and took the dish to go as I had work in less than 30 mins. 

I left the restaurant only to be stopped by a "customer" of theirs hitting on me telling me that the Thai place was THE best thai place he's ever gone to in the city. I was excited. Thrown off by getting hit on but excited that I was going to enjoy something really good before work started.

I got to work, bit into one of the pineapples and spat it out in disgust as it tasted like the pineapple had been sitting in sink water all day. I was so disappointed and thought maybe it's just one pineapple so I bit into another. Same result. I thought, "maybe there's something wrong with my taste buds" and asked my coworker to taste it for me and he had the same reaction. 

I don't know if pineapples in this dish are supposed to be watered down and taste like pretty much "nothing" but when I called and they asked me how the *rice* tasted, I was confused... The rice itself tasted fine but I think anyone, including me, who orders pineapple fried rice expects the pineapples to taste like pineapples. 

I explained that I work in the area and that I can't go back to get this replaced (but ended up doing so) and they agreed to give me a new dish of the same value to compensate my tasteless meal. 

I ended up switching it for a veggie and rice dish and a thai iced tea which, for the price I paid for the pineapple rice, was not worth it. At least that one TASTED better though... 

I was hoping the food I had ordered wouldve been good especially after that awkward encounter after leaving the restaurant the first time but... This place gets 2 stars.. The person on the phone also told me they were busy and had a line (urging me to get off the phone) but I was JUST there and it wasn't busy (with only 1 - 3 guests) and when I came back, 5 mins after the phone call, there was no one there at all.

I'd rather go back to my Thai places of choice where although far and just as much (if not, a little less) as this place, the food is savory and good enough to WANT to come back.
author: Clarizeyale R.

description:
Went in on a Sunday at about 12:20pm; it was completely empty. Very nice interior- pretty pictures and a nice relaxing green backdrop.

Service was nice but i was supposed to get 22 cents back and he only gave me 20 cents... now I don't want to be a prick about 2 cents but c'mon LOL at least ask me. 

Ordered a tofu pad thai w/ no beansprouts. It was DELICIOUS but the carrots seemed a bit undercooked....that was my only concern. Other than that, it was good! I also wished that they would ask how spicy i wanted it, because it had NO SPICE whatsoever. But maybe that's my fault for not asking. I don't eat enough thai to know what the proper way of order pad thai is, haha.

Friendly service, amaaazing pad thai, and pretty interior.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Not sure why this place doesn't have better reviews. I work around here so I've been to this place plenty of times for lunch and I keep going back.

1. The food is good - I really like the Pad Thai, and Ive had some of the curries, which were pretty good. The only con here is that when asking for non-spicy, the food is still pretty spicy but then again, it's Thai food.

2. The quantity is great - usually a single order lasts me for 2 meals, and for the price, the food is pretty good.

3. Don't know why this place gets a bad rep for service, I have always had a very pleasant experience, whether I am dining in or taking-out. The staff is friendly and the place is pretty clean, which is a plus!

4. It's not the cheapest food but it is very reasonable, especially for the area.
author: Sarah D.

description:
There used to be another Thai restaurant at this corner...they closed down and I was looking forward to Bai Thong opening...little did I know.  It's very close to my work place, so I've eaten there more than a few times.

Unfortunately, as much as I want to like it....their service really, I mean REALLY did them in for me.  It's as though I'm walking into their living room, bothering them.  No friendly smiles, just unpleasantness...their Emerald Fried Rice (Green Curry Fried Rice) is really yummy.  But all it took was for one of the waitresses to inform me that I need to order hot water the moment I sit down and not wait (so she will not need to be bothered with bringing the ice cold water before asking me if I want any)...or else!
Maybe I'm dense...or maybe I like their food or maybe I'm the kind of person who is willing to give others another chance...it's happened a few times....
