No can do...I cannot possibly spend my hard earned money at a place where they do not even try to be nice.....
author: Barb L.

description:
I'm sad to report that the food at this restaurant tastes bad (in my opinion!).   I went in the other day and grabbed some pad thai and tom kha gai soup.   

The pad thai tasted like some kind of animal fat - or some other odd flavor that I couldn't quite recognize.

The Tom Kha Gai also seemed "off" - again, I could't recognize the flavor but I found it inedible.   

Sorry I can't be more descriptive but I threw this meal in the trash - and I can't remember the last time that I did that!
author: Melissa D.

description: This place used to be decent but the quality of food and the attitude of the employees have really gotten worse over the years. I used to love the spring rolls but now they're just crap w sparse ingredients.
author: Phil M.

description: All I can say, is excellent food, (pad see-ew is my favorite!), friendly staff, in a great location, their tea is delicious, food is prepared quickly, they play awesome tunes while you eat, and the ambience is both relaxing and interesting. The prices are decent, especially considering the portions of food they serve. I have absolutely nothing bad to say.....except now I'm craving Thai now...
author: Valentina R.

description: I've been going here for years - very convenient to my home & work. The food is pretty solid Thai and consistent from visit to visit. The prices are reasonable, especially the lunch specials. The service is friendly, too. Seems like restaurants come and go, but this one is a survivor and consistently good. Favorites = the ahi tuna salad and San Francisco Giants soup (basically a tom kha soup with added pumpkin/squash). My son is a fan of the chicken satay and the beef drunk man's noodles.
author: Kim M.

description: Worst pad Thai I've ever had. Everything was completely overcooked and the food felt like it had been just warmed up. When I told the waitress about it, she didn't care at all. Not recommended.
author: Bertrand S.

description: Tried the Larb, Green Curry, Emerald Fried Rice, and Lime Tilapia.  The food quality is OK, but a tad pricey for the smaller than expected portion size.  Pros are that it is not a noisy restaurant, which is so rare in SF.  I will eat here again if I happen to be in the area, but would not go out of my way to eat here.
author: MT Y.

description:
I came to San Francisco to visit my friend. Walked around the Hayes Valley did some shopping in the area. Need yummy food. Searched and found Bai Thong Thai.
Green curry fried rice is so good. Sticky rice with mango is a must have for desert.
Everybody was sweet and friendly to me. Felt happy and lucky to find this place to fill my empty tummy right in town.
author: Tuc M.

description: My go-to place for good, inexpensive Thai food. They have all my favorites, including pad thai, chicken satay and tom kha chicken coconut soup. My picky Thai friend ordered Tom Yum soup and declared it delicious! I often get yellow or Mussamun curry (chicken), and their jasmine white rice is hot! Larb and spicy basil are two more favorites, and try the mango trout! Of course, always thai ice tea and fried banana for dessert!
author: Joe S.

description:
One of the worst restaurant experiences I've ever had. TERRIBLE service.

Very few vegetarian options on the menu--and expect to pay extra if you want tofu instead of meat.

I had to ask 4 times for my sticky rice, even though the restaurant wasn't busy.  When it finally arrived it was rock hard and dried out, probably from hours before.

The two meals ordered arrived with a large gap in between.

Sat for about 25 minutes waiting for the bill, and finally walked up to the register to pay there.

When we finally got out of there it felt like we had escaped--it was that bad.
author: Alicia J.

description:
It's fine. It's fine! The food is of average quality. I got the "San Francisco Giants" soup (which, okay, fine, probably not super authentic, but the menu item was all colored orange in the menu and I guess I kind of implicitly figured it was special somehow), which was basically chicken coconut soup with pumpkin in it. It wasn't bad, but it was kind of unspectacular.

The service wasn't particularly remarkable. A little on the slow side, maybe? And the prices seemed a bit high. $11 for a soup that was more of an $8 affair. These are nits, but I suppose in the dog-eat-dog world of restauranting, every nit counts.

Final analysis? It's Thai food. Thai food is great. Go here if you're in the area and hankering for Thai. Otherwise, you'll probably do better trying one of the other great restaurants in the area.
author: Greg P.

description: I love this place. Everyone who works here is extremely nice and accommodating. I've always had great food, especially the curry on the lunch special. Took some friends here in the evening for a tower of Singha and some fried rice, and it was excellent for a great price; a rarity in Hayes Valley these days.
author: Alec N.

description:
Being the only place within walking distance that would be able to seat a party of 8 on a Saturday in a reasonable amount of time, we decided to give this place a try. Though they seated us down right away, they took a surprising amount of time to take our orders. We ordered family style with each person having a little bit of every plate. After ordering the food came in a reasonable amount of time.

The Tom Kha soup was pretty good, but their "large" for $16 is simply not worth it. It was the size of a regular bowl of soup-- enough for each person to have about 2 spoonfuls.

Their meat (chicken and salmon in separate dishes) that they served was dry and chewy. The consistency of meat that had been boiled for way too long. Definitely won't be ordering any meat from them again.

The eggplant that we had was great! Good flavors, good consistency, and was loved by all.

As a HUGE fan of mango sticky rice, this was a solid B+. Nothing wrong, but left more to be desired.

Prices were very reasonable, especially in San Francisco. Nothing too special about this place though... Probably won't be back.
author: Sophie S.

description:
Fantastic Thai food, good prices, very friendly staff. Great place for groups, as there's never a wait!

I've been about 5 times and tried many dishes. Favorites are the Drunken Noodles and the Basil Twister (string beans and eggplant).

Easily the best thai food in Hayes Valley.
author: Chris M.

description: Lively little gem close to the opera and symphony. We have been here several times. Tge food is great and the service is very quick
author: Garry P.

description:
When I found an eggshell in my food, I thought it only right to let the server know! Surprisingly, she replied "It happens. Not gonna kill you." 
Apology? Nope.
author: Matteo M.

description: I live a block and a half away and eat Bai Thong Thai probably once a week. They are super speedy, friendly and reasonably priced. I dig their noodles, curries, and other stir-fry stuff... Particularly the cashew chicken dish. I came up with a remix to R. Kelly's 'Bump and Grind' that is, 'I don't see nothing wrongggg, with a little Bai Thong Thai' that my roomies and I get down to. They also have a TV that is usually tuned to 'the game' and big Singhas and towers if you're looking to party low-key.
author: Sean D.

description:
lers ros is always busy and I wanted to try this neighborhood spot out.  it's not cheaper here much to my surprise.

5 stars-- the fresh roll was delicious and has black sesame!  will come back for this

2 stars-- the drunken noodle.  way too much noodle not enough veggies.  I admit there was a good serving of pork.  no flavor either except for a spicy chili flakes.

overall I would come back as I see clear regulars (mostly ordering takeout) but try some other things on the menu.
author: Mabel F.

description: The Food was okay. So was the service. Nothing special. There're better places around.
author: Daniel R.

description: The fried rice is stiff and very dry. The rice noodle is just average. In general, it's not an impressive place.
author: QL M.

description:
After reading Jason B.'s review, I couldn't bare the temptation any longer--I opted for the pumpkin curry with Chicken. It tasted fantastic going down...and that's where it all changes. 

I wanted to call Bai Thong and give them a discrete comment as to what occurred just 4 hours later (for those of you that know timing in digestion...you may now stop reading).  Had they the class and etiquette in handling of such genteel matters of a finer establishment, I would have remained silent, given them 3 stars, and been on way. Such was not the case. 

DO NOT GO HERE. You will spend your evening in the bathroom. Food poisoning -- be ware.
author: Maggie C.

description: Bugs in your food!!Only come here if you like insect thai ice tea.
author: Don Z.

description: We enjoyed the decor, courteous and prompt service and the food was flavorful, fresh and healthy - our favorite was the SF Giants coconut soup with pumpkin and the spring rolls. They also have many vegetarian options, great prices and are open until 11pm. Yum!
author: Maria C.

description: Delicious, no nonsense Panang Curry. I live right around the corner from here and order take out quite a bit. The staff is always very nice and the service is very quick. It's not the swankiest place by any means, could probably use an interior decorator, but if you're not on a first date it's perfectly quaint. Plus, they're open until 11 most nights, which has come in very handy more than a few times.
author: Chad F.

description: The first time that I had gone there, it was a lovely meal but tonight's was plain BAD. I ordered the grilled swordfish and when I took one bite I had to spit it out. The fish was obviously frozen fish from a long time ago. It smelled and tasted horrible. My friend ordered the pumpkin curry with pork and she happy with it, but not impressed either.  Maybe they changed cook...I cannot recommend this place.
author: N H.

description: Quick food to-go.  Lunch special is cheap enough, entree plus a drink for $7.  Pad See Ew was a bit too salty, but good enough for lunch.
author: Karen L.

description:
I go here for emergencies - when I'm low on blood sugar, don't feel like cooking, and craving Asian food. In a nutshell:  
* The selection is ok.  The food is tasty.
* Hayes Valley fares, i.e. somewhat pricey for some of the standard dishes.
* Not Hayes Valley fare, i.e. the dishes can be a bit small and not particularly extraordinary.

All in all, I'd recommend this place if you're close by.  The staff is nice.  And the meal will be decent.  If you want to trek, Best of Thai on Upper Haight is also a good basic Thai eatery, and they deliver.
author: Emit S.

description: This is my second try here! I'm writing this review while I am still in the restaurant cos the food was Yuck!! Right when the waiter brought the food to the table, I saw hair in my food!! How gross!! He took it back and and like 5 mins later brought it back to the table and said it made new!! But how could it possible when I was waiting for the food for 15mins at first and he brought it back in 5 mins. The food was so salty!!! Enough, won't come back here! GROSS!
author: Lily H.

description: I have been going to this restaurant for seven years. I'm a loyal patron both for eat in, take out, and delivery. Today I ordered for delivery and was told 20 minutes. The lady on the phone didn't seem to understand everything I was saying, so I reiterated multiple times that it is for delivery. After 50 minutes I called and she picked up and said it was ready...but it was for delivery...confused she gave the phone to a guy. He said they didn't have anyone to deliver so it would be ANOTHER 20-30 minutes. I complained that my food would be cold and I have already waited 30 minutes longer than I was told, so he actually came quickly (5 minutes) which I was happy about. Then he asked for the payment and I explained I gave my credit card number to the lady on the phone. He said they take cash only for delivery. I was so confused because as I said I have been ordering here for 7 years and have NEVER paid cash. He said sorry that's the policy and took the food and left!!!! Are you serious!!!!! After making me wait an hour for my food and not taking a form of payment I have always used for this restaurant you high jack my food?!?! I don't know if they are under new management or ownership, but this is unacceptable. This is how they treat loyal patrons?!?!? Well I guess Lers Ros just became my go-to Thai food spot. So angry...and hungry...right now.
author: Tara D.

description:
Really bad service. The worst. We went there on Sunday night and there was only one inexperienced server who wasn't able to serve 5 tables at the same time. We never got our drinks not even water, he brought food before appetizers, he was on a phone picking up delivery orders while angry customer were waiting to make an order or even get a menu for over 20 min. 
I feel really bad for a guy but he had no clue about serving at all... and how did owner let it happened? is here no servers with a bit of experience in this city?
Food wasn't good either... It's more like take-out quality food.
author: Tat R.

description: The food is very fresh and the flavors blend together perfectly.   I had the barbecue pork with mango salad and the pork was lean and very tasty, the mango salad was exquisite with the pork.   My husband had the yellow curry chicken, slightly spicy but flavorful and vegetables, especially carrots were not overcooked.   We have been here three times and each time we have said we will come back, a great place to eat before going to Davies Symphony Hall.
author: Mary F.

description: This place deserves all 5 stars plus some! Peanut Sauce is off the hook. Portion sizes are perfect with fast service! Super clean in a relaxing atmosphere! A local gem that I am coming back to!
author: Antoinette S.

description:
The food was flavorful and fast.
Service was perfunctory.
Not a bad experience!
author: Yo M.

description:
For the mothafucken service, period. Weena, our waitress was nice as fuck. 
Food, bomb as usual. Khap-kooun-kup
author: Jay M.

description:
Good food, large portions, family owned and fast delivery. Whats not to like!

I usually go for the pumpkin curry and pad kee mao (drunk mans noodles) and you get lots of the protein of your choosing and fresh vegetables.

They also have beer towers which are great for a large group who want to have some fun.
author: Jennifer K.

description: Their tropical mango panang curry is amazing!! The pad thai is really good too! Great service! Calling ahead when ordering takeout is a good call.
author: Berenice O.

description: I went to this restaurant when I was in the SF area and it was a great experience. Enjoyed a few vegetable dishes and it was everything I could want in Asian cuisine. Highly recommended.
author: Dodge S.

description:
I love this place, I eat here (almost) once a week, and have brought in at least 10 of my friends at different times to try the food.  I love that the owner knows my name and the servers are all very friendly and pleasant to be around.

Try the Pad See Ew and a Beer Tower!
author: Chris K.

description: The food was terrible and repetitive. The service was slow and inattentive. They started cleaning the floors with high fume cleaning during the end if the meal. Not a good experience
author: Adi G.

description:
Im new to the hood so I've been sampling a lot of the local spots. This place kind of disappointed. I was hoping to have a great, nearby thai spot. 

The service was kind of slow even though only three tables were occupied in this 20-30 top restaurant. 

I ordered the Tom Kha soup which was ok. I also got panang curry with chicken. The curry wasnt really spicy and the chicken was not good.  My thai iced tea was good though. 

Something that tipped me off to this places legitimacy was when I was asked to pay cash after I had given my card. I didn't have enough cash but that's not the point. They were asking -everybody-
Are they in need of cash or did they not want to pay the transaction fee?  They ran my card and that was that. 

I probably don't intend to go back.
author: James G.

description:
Came here before heading out to a concert. Parking wasn't too hard to find. They're definitely friendly, but strike 1 was the fact that they couldn't serve alcohol yet, but their menu had beer on it. Strike 2 was that they ran out of wide noodles for their pad see ew. They have an SF Giants soup that is good, but not great.

A positive for them:  the emerald fried rice was good.

3 stars bc it's decent. And if I was craving Thai food and I was in the area, I might come back.
author: Fran H.

description: My pad thai was so bad it was basically inedible.
author: Devan A.

description:
If you love the color orange, this is probably a pretty good time in your life. Halloween, our unofficial citywide holiday, is just around the corner. And the Giants are on quite the postseason run. Have a good time with all that.

Now for me, I don't quite get what all the fuss is about. I've never been a big Halloween fan (perhaps a creative deficiency?) and I'd rather watch orange paint dry than watch sports. In a Halloween costume.

However, something orange we can likely agree on is pumpkin curry. Mmmm.....there are few things better than warm slices of pumpkin in a succulent sauce. It's my go to whenever I see it on the menu, as was the case at Bai Thong. Newly opened in Hayes Valley, they do it right, with plenty of pumpkin and chicken, a few veggies, and a reasonable $10 price tag. All with friendly service.

My only regret is not bringing friends to sample other good looking items on the menu, namely the steamed veggies and tofu, and the chicken and prawn combo. Next time.

And back to the color orange, if you are a fan of all three things, I wish you a happy Halloween watching the Giants win while eating some pumpkin curry. Just save some for me.
author: Jason B.

description: Pretty darn good ... and there is nothing wrong with that! Nice folks, fresh and authentic food at reasonable prices. I found the service just fine. Should probably be 3.5 stars, but I think rounding up is fair in this case. A Really good, midrange place
author: Mike W.

description:
It's a bone chilling and rainy in SF today... so no better time than now to go get some curry, right?

And damn, this was good.

My lunchmate and i split the Massaman curry with chicken and the Drunk Man's Noodles with pork.

 It was a conscious decision by both of us to stop eating otherwise we'd be risking split pants at work for the rest of the afternoon, which isn't such a hot look.

Now I am thankful for the leftovers.

Their hot tea isn't just your avg green you get most places - it's hot THAI tea. It smells incredible and has a light, lovely taste. And it will surely warm the cockles of your heart on any day that's cold and gray. 

Why not 5 stars, you ask? Some service irregularities, that's why. But hey, that leaves room for improvement, no? And will get me to come back to check on their progress... soon.
author: Liz K.

description:
Walked in at 8pm on a Saturday night and the place was a ghost town. First clue we should have just turned around.

Ordered Rama the King, and it came out about 5 minutes later (how did they cook this fresh so fast?). The server delivered my entree about 5 minutes before she delivered my friend's. Awkward. So I'm sitting at the table staring at this entree (and kind of revolted by the fact that the peanut sauce on top of the veggies has the consistency of a brain), and it just looks like steamed vegetables and microwaved tofu with a ladle of sauce on it. Unimpressed. Should have returned it and gone somewhere else.

When my friend's meal came, mine was cold, and both were just OK. Don't really have a lot more to say so I'll sum it up by saying (1) mediocre food (2) amateur service. Beware of any Hayes Valley restaurant that's empty on a Saturday night.
author: Justin H.

description:
First time in San Francisco and decided to try this place near our hotel. Excellent choice! Friendly waitstaff, cozy atmosphere, and delicious food.

The pumpkin curry was great! I highly recommend it. Don't expect your typical fall spices like a pumpkin soup, but mild with a little kick. One note: If you want extra rice, it is an additional $3.

Our other dish was the veggie noodle soup. If you want simple (i.e. bland) with no frills then that's what you will get with this soup. Fresh veggies, good noodles, but zero flavor on it's own. All you need to do is ask for the spice tray and then customize it to your own tastes. Not as good as a full range of Pho offerings, so I might recommend trying a different soup next time.

Worth a try!
author: Brenna O.

description:
Tried them out for dinner with a friend a little while back (had the pumpkin curry) and it was yummy. Just about on par with other Thai places re: price.

But just found out about their lunch specials. They offer a few different dishes (pad thai, pad see yew, yellow curry, and sometimes massaman curry -- GET THE MASSAMAN!) and a drink (including Thai iced tea!). Only $7. But cash only for the lunch specials. It's made up "to go" style but you can eat it there.

I will probably be back as I work just down the street. But that's a-ok with me!
author: Matthew B.

description: I literally sat there for 25 minutes at a table and no-one acknowledged my existence, gave me a plate or cutlery or even cared to enquire about the situation. Outrageous and pathetic. I won't be back.
author: Anil P.

description:
All around a fine Thai establishment. Great for meeting someone casually for a meal.  We're not talking absolutely exquisite food or service, but it was good tasty food, with friendly people, quick service, and reasonable prices. 

I had the fried rice with coconut milk and asparagus and enjoyed it. My friend got the salmon dish, which came served in a bowl made of leaves. It looked small upon being presented, but it was reported to be tasty, ample and filling.

I won't insist that you go way out of your way to get here, but if in the area, or if looking for delivery, check it out and you'll be happy with your choice.

Next time I'll try the dessert!
author: Nikhil N.

description:
Meh..

Ya, that about sums up this place. It's food. Thai food. It's eatable. And that's about it.

Nothing I had there stood out, and the service was average. I'm sure there are more exciting and tasty places, they just have a good location.

Really this place is nothing to write home (or Yelp) about...
author: Erik B.

description:
I'm so lucky to live right across from this tasty Thai restaurant. It has taken me 2 years, but apparently it used to be called Thepin Thai, and it has since been remodeled and now under new ownership.

I've had 4 dishes and they have all been delicious thus far:

Pumpkin curry - So savory and lipsmacking good
Pad Thai w/ prawns & chicken - Yummmmers
Pad Seew - Delectable
Papaya Salad - Fresh, tangy & spicy

For a while my go-to Thai place was Osha, but now that I have BAI THONG, I can happily satisfy my Thai food craving a skip and a hop away!
author: Helen L.

description: Ideal place for dinner before a Jazz Center concert. Just a block away. Great prices, friendly service, nice enough room. We had crispy rolls, sea salmon, lemongrass chicken. I'd go back in a heartbeat. Highly recommended.
author: Elizabeth R.

description: This a cute little Thai place. I had the King & I. It was great. The chicken was still juicy, and the salad that came with had the perfect amount of shrimp to salad to dressing ratio. Service also great  got sat quickly and food came in a timely manner. Glad I stopped by to have lunch here :)
author: Liz C.

description: My husband and I came here on a whim.  I am glad that I didn't read the reviews on yelp first or else I would have never tried this place.  The food was very good and very reasonably priced.  The Pad Thai with tofu was delicious. An appetizer and two entrees is the perfect amount of food for two people. The service was very friendly and helpful.
author: Caitlin R.

description: We were in SF and while visiting Alcatraz a couple told us about this place so we decided to try it. The service was top notch. Our whole group loved the food. I checked the bathroom out and it was very clean as was the whole place. Bathrooms always tell you if the kitchen is clean. I was very impressed. This is authentic Thai cuisine, I only wish I could Thai food this good back in the Midwest where we are from. We ended up eating there twice on our trip. They even let me take pictures inside I guess they are use to tourists.
author: Jenni R.

description: Early dinner before the symphony. Very few customers, we're the 3rd couple. Slow service. Waitress didn't know their dishes. I asked her how the salmon was cooked before they put the curry. She showed me a picture like I can figure it out from the picture.
author: Lizzie B.

description:
The short version: writing this from my hotel toilet, only left this restaurant 15 minutes ago. 

Long version: of course this happens the one time I don't yelp my dinner. All I had was the asparagus delight, which was sauce, tofu & asparagus. $10. Plus $2 for a fistful of rice. 3/4 through my meal I already felt a little queasy, and now I'm here...on the toilet...not happy. My brother is waiting to use it next. He got the spicy Basil. Stay away dudes. Opt for paxtis pizza instead, its just a few blocks over.
author: Ashley P.

description:
I'm a big Thai food fan and this is really good Thai food.  Service is good - efficient and friendly.  Not sure why this place is only getting three stars!

NOTE:  This food is SPICEY!  If you like "medium" spice, order "mild".  If you order "hot" you are very brave.
author: Jeff T.

description:
This place is extraordinary!!! Your business is highly appreciated and the service you get is the best that there is. It is a rightly priced menu and you get a large portion. Very clean atmosphere, conveniently located. 

Would recommend to anyone looking for good smelling, good tasting authentic Thai food.

A+
author: Timber B.

description: Quite a fan of this place. Good food. Fast and nice service. Great prices!
author: Anna C.

description: This restaurant has a relaxed, warm atmosphere where one can go for a casual dinner with little wait on a Saturday. We ordered spring rolls and the pumpkin red curry. The spring rolls were amazing, but the pumpkin red curry was a little too watery for my taste (some may be a fan, but I like my red/yellow/green curries with a thicker "sauce" base.) Overall though, very nice/good service and food that I wouldn't mind having on a weeknight I don't feel like cooking but I have a crazy Thai craving!
author: Ari R.

description: Food is so bland. Vegetables are not very flavorful / fresh. Prices are not that great. There's no real reason to ever go here. It's always empty in this restaurant when I walk by.
author: John N.

description:
Welcome to the newcomer in the neighborhood.  This place is miles ahead of Thepin Thai, which used to inhabit the space.  One of the co-owners is a lovely Thai woman who very clearly cares about their patrons' experience.  The food is above average and seems to be authentic Thai, other than the lack of heat, which I'll give them another chance to get right.  Their opening weekend was packed (half off!) and while service dragged a bit, the kitchen had to have been working at 150% speed.

Prices are reasonable, the meat is quality.

Notable dishes are the fresh rolls, pepper beef and a chicken dish with cashews and red pepper... though I forgot the name.  The sticky rice and mango was well-prepared, as well.
author: ben y.

description:
Great to have solid, inexpensive, ethnic food in the neighborhood. Options for that in Hayes Valley are sorely limited. And as other reviewers have mentioned, this new restaurant is definitely a step above the last one that occupied this space. Spring rolls were very fresh and served with a delicious sauce. Tom Yum was very good but could have used more spice. Pumpkin curry was excellent, and they have brown rice, which made my day.

I live within spitting distance, so I could easily become a regular here.
author: Leigh A.

description: Calamari app was a decent size but mildly favored, as a different sauce was found at the bottom of the dish; its presentation needs work.  Their soups are good and refreshing.
author: L T.

description:
Better-than-average Thai food with huge portions. If I was in the area and wanted Thai I'd come here, or get takeout.

The Bai Thong Pad Thai dish I had was fairly straightforward, but I should have gone for one of the more distinct menu items (lots of dishes here that seem interesting and unfamiliar). Next time!
author: Alan F.

description:
maybe i just ordered the wrong thing (SF Giants soup, basically your standard tom kha gai plus pumpkin) but i was not super impressed. 

over $10 for not even that much. no thanks.
author: Ronny K.

description:
Bai Thong is a big improvement over Thepin Thai, which was the last restaurant in this space. They are just getting started, so some hiccups are to be expected. We are always searching for good Thai restaurants and are happy that a good one finally opened up in Hayes Valley. 

The aromatic pumpkin curry was excellent. That's a definite winner, as are the drunken noodles. The Pad Thai was good - not great, just good. 

We'll be returning.
author: A A.

description: Not sure what to say except the food just wasn't good.  It's like someone was cooking Thai food for the first time from a cookbook.  Or like cooking something that's fine if it's just you or you and a close friend at home, but you would never serve it to a bunch of people for a dinner party.  It wasn't quite inedible, hence the two stars instead of one, but to think that we paid over $50 for two glasses of wine, an appetizer, and two entrees that didn't taste good still irritates me.  And to have a Thai place like this -- in San Francisco, of all cities?  Inexcusable.
author: Carlo A.

description: Just a good and dependable local Thai restaurant.  Bai Thong has a friendly staff and offers delicious Thai cuisine.  I usually order for pickup, and have eaten food from this location 20 times or more.
author: Mike W.

description: service was BEYOND TERRIBLE. I don't think I've ever experienced such negligent service before. There is no reason, whatsoever, for any customer to have to constantly ask for things and try to find workers for service (hellllooo this is not finding waldo!!). My friend and I were the only customers in the whole restaurant and we were seated for dinner. We had to wave over the worker to take our order (really, when we're the only customers we have to wave you down??). We ordered the panang curry and drunk man's noodles and they were absolutely scrumptious. Wanted hot sauce, couldn't find a worker for 5 mins, then finally waved one down and brought it to us. Later we wanted two spoons for the curry and it took 10 mins just to get their attention. After we were done eating it took another 15 minutes of sitting around until I finally had to signal I wanted the check, and then another 10 mins until they did the card transaction. They never once asked us if the everything was alright, or if we needed anything. The servers/workers would talk to each other and ignore us as if our asking for hot sauce was interrupting their dire need for conversation. Food was good, workers NOT.
author: Hannah K.

description: Bai Thong's food is on par with most quick Thai restaurants. Dishes are slightly overpriced when bought in house. Be weary when going by the take-out prices onilne as the costs are much different from the actual menu in the restaurant (Tom Yum Combination soup was $6 more than advertised online). With that said, the quality of food is decent - especially for Hayes Valley.
author: Jonathan C.

description: it was ok, only went there becuse nothig else was open. We ordered food to go, and it didn't take long to be ready. I ordered jasmine rice, I got white, and the dish I ordered was kinda "watery."  Id go back, but not my best Thai experience.
author: Reyna O.

description: Me and a group of 4 people went here about 9pm on a friday night. Awesome experience! They had the nicest service, and the food was traditional and AMAZING. The portions of food you get for the price are spot on. We also got the "tower of beer"! Great little gem in Hayes Valley.
author: J R.

description: I come here a lot since I work about half a block away. The food is okay and I usually order from Grubhub and just pick it up. Not much customer service to speak of though; it just seems like they're constantly understaffed. So if you're planning to get the food to-go, have at it. If you're planning to dine in, it would probably be worth walking two blocks over to Lers Ros, where the food is much better and so is the customer service.
author: Gloria Z.

description: Ordered online and picked up in 10 minutes. Food was excellent and we will definitely be making this a regular neighborhood Thai experience.
author: Jeff S.

description: I live a block from this place and come to get dinner whenever everything else is closed.  The most fitting word to describe the food here is edible.  I've had the pad thai, pad see ew, and thai fried rice.  These are supposed to be really popular dishes, but what they give here is just plain bland.  The size is large, but there's a few times where I end up throwing it away because I just don't want to have it for a second meal.
author: Carrie L.

description: As guests in town we came here because it was walking distance from our hotel. The waitresses and staff were super nice and helpful. The portions were large, enough for one person or even to split if you're getting other dishes. The Tom Yum was not the best I've had, a little too sweet for my liking. I got a side of rice and it came in the shape of a heart which was so cute! The Emerald Fried Rice was the best out of the dishes we had. The perfect amount of green curry and basil! We ordered the Mango Sticky Rice for dessert and the stick rice also came in the shape of a heart. Overall good Thai food and good price, but not an authentic Thai experience.
author: Anita C.

description: Our local Thai restaurant never disappoints. Big fan of spicy egg plant and Panang curry.  I want to try other things but those two are just too good. Reasonable prices and nice service.
author: ellen m.

description: This place is right below my office and I go there about twice a month for lunch, once every two months for dinner. Great lunch menu with large portions - I leave feeling full every time. Good atmosphere with some cool pictures of Thai hill tribe elders and children on the walls. Staff is always friendly too. I recommend the rama the king and basil twister for vegetarians.
author: Matt F.

description:
I had the tofu salad, which was very tasty, sweet and spicy.

The Tom Kha was one of the worst I've had.  It was not spicy at all and it was kind of sweet.  I added the hot sauce in it to make it better, but it just didn't feel like it was made with any care.. 

The ambience was very nice, and so was the staff
author: San D.

description: I ordered to go curry and pad see ew and was happy with the large portions, particularly for the curry!  There was plenty to share and the flavors were great.  I would be excited to go back and try something different!
author: Elizabeth H.

description: I have been eating at Bai Thong for some time now.  I find there food fresh, clean, flavorful, and spiced "just right."  The service is friendly and helpful and there food is consistently delicious.  There Spicy Pumpkin is just terrific.  I have had several of their rice dishes and was very impressed.  Prices are good and fair for the quality of the food served.  Check it out.
author: Robert A.

description: This place is tasty.  I like the "Ducky Curry" and you can't go wrong with the basics.  They make the rice the way I like it and really, it's up to par with anywhere else I've been.  They also give you unlimited rice.  Other than that, they are super friendly and serve you with a smile.
author: Josephine C.

description: I work across the street and have been eating here for years.  The food is consistently tasty and fresh.  The decor is cheery and artful.  The staff is consistently kind and attentive.  In this over-priced neighborhood of shee-shee macaroon shops I appreciate still being able to buy a healthy, delicious meal for a reasonable price.  Thank you Bai Thong!.
author: Amy H.

description: Drunken Man Noodles were ok, but I wish they would have been spicier.  It was a very large portion for the price, however.  That atmosphere and service was good but nothing special.
author: John G.

description: This is a great addition to the neighborhood. Definitely the best Thai food in this area, and some of the best Thai food I've had in SF. They have flavorful dishes, generous portions, a bright and cheerful interior, and lovely staff. I hope more people hear about them and give them a try. We'll definitely be back!
author: Alexandra L.

description: This is THE LAST TIME I WILL EVER that I will order from here. The service is horrible! I wanted to give them one last chance and unfortunately, this is it!!! The last time I tried ordering from them, they hung up on me. RUDE!!!! First mistake... Never hang up on a paying customer! You messed up my order and I had to pay more money for a mistake you made. I was so fed up, I should have just walked out of there without paying but I'm not the rude type so I gladly paid for your mistake for the last time. Your food is ok at that. Your service is horrible. HORRIBLE! HORRIBLE! I won't recommend you to any of my co-workers! I wouldn't recommend you to anyone! Go somewhere else... You're better off.
author: Sisounthone S.

description: On my way home tonight, I stopped in at Bai Thong Thai Cuisine for some Pumpkin Curry over rice.  Yum, Yum, Yum!  I added some Simosa's and it was a perfect match.  I've eaten here three times and I have always had a great meal.  I give it 4 stars because I've only had takeout and can't remark on their service.  But I'm sure it's good.  This is Hayes Valley's little gem that's now become a fav of mine!  Try their bai thong beef (it's their specialty).
author: Ryan B.

description: I'm sorry to say that this was the worst Thai food I've ever had. Everything I ordered was excessively sweet to the point of being inedible. The soup was syrupy sweet, and contained canned mushrooms and quarter-sized chunks of hard ginger with the texture of tree bark. I threw most of the food away. The staff seems nice, and the decor is much improved, but the food was just not good.
author: J. K.

description: The pumpkin dish with chicken was to die for. But my friends got a dish with rice beef and seafood and said it was disgusting. Customer service is very poor. Also very overpriced I paid 13 dollars for just some sauce a little bit of chicken and vegetables. It didn't even come with white rice she wanted to charge 2 dollars just for that. They are very cheap and want to rush you out as well.
author: Shelley E.

description: I tried this restaurant last Tuesday 11/9, after buying a Certificate on Restaurant.com.  I tried calling a few times before leaving, but their line was busy.  I figured that they might be busy, but I drove 30 minutes from my house to get there.  When I arrived, I was greeted by a nice man who seated us, gave us our menus, took our drink order and eventually took down our order.   The service was good, and the food was tasty, although I don't eat Thai food very often, so I might not be a good judge of what is good Thai.  We ordered an appetizer that was very tasty, but it was small and expensive for what was paid for.  My biggest complaint is the Restaurant refused to take the Restaurant.com coupon, stating that they were not accepting the coupons at this time!  There was another lady who was dining there, who was in the same boat as I was, and she was pretty upset.  I talked to the folks at Restaurant.com and they stated that this was a breach in the contract between them and the Restaurant.
author: P. O.

description: Good Thai food cooked by real Thai people. My Thai wife eats here frequently, and our half-Thai daughter has lunch here 3 times every week. Not the most elegant, and sometimes service is lacking (see other posts--our experiences are comparable, but it only happens now and then, not regularly), but overall very satisfying. You must be specific about how spicy you want it!
author: Biggy B.

description: I have only gotten food to go.  The service was pleasant and the order came out quick.  The food is average in quality and average in price.  Cute location and spacious but is usually empty when I walk by.  I can't imagine things are going to pick up with Lers Ros opening around the corner but everyone was so nice I will at least light a candle for you and hope things go well.  Don't call me, I'll call you
author: Jay B.

description: We came here on a Saturday night before a San Francisco Symphony concert and were very pleasantly surprised.  We arrived early and were seated promptly with a cup of hot Thai tea.  Wonderful!  We shared the spring rolls, then my husband had the spicy string beans with pork that he raved about.  I had the salmon in red curry, served in a banana leaf cup.  Very pretty presentation.  Afterwards, we had some sort of sweet pudding that was a little like tapioca but had a sweet, fruity flavor.  I was a little hesitant to try it, but it was awesomely good.  We will definitely be back!
author: Karen P.

description: Wanted to try this place because I love Thai food.  We ordered pumpkin curry with pork and pad thai vegetarian.  The flavors were great in both dishes BUT the pork in the curry was BAD (spoiled) .  We told the waitress and she was very accommodating and would take it off our bill.  When the bill came, she didn't take it off because the manager said, "there is nothing wrong with the pork".  Guess I won't be going back!!
author: Sandra L.

description: This place just opened up and I can already tell that it will be there for a while. When it comes to Thai food (or southeast Asian food in general), I'm a bit of a stickler. However, Bai Thong exceeded all of my expectations. The waiter was courteous and seemed genuinely interested in providing a quality dining experience. The menu was surprisingly affordable as well. The pork wonton appetizer was the perfect prelude to the meal (highly recommended!). The best feature about the meal had to be subtle flavors that accompanied each entree. Unlike most Thai places, Bai Thong really let the quality of the produce and meat speak for itself. The seafood was fresh and nothing felt over salted. I will definitely be making this place a regular stop when craving some quality Asian cuisine.
author: Emilio B.

description: I've been here twice and enjoyed it both times. Cool atmosphere, reasonable prices, good food (I'm a vegetarian), friendly service. What's not to like? :)
author: Stacey J.

description: Stopped here recently to pick up a quick meal to go and was very impressed. Inviting decor, the food is delicious and the staff very friendly. Highly recommend, will definitely be a favorite place to dine in the neighborhood.
author: Kelly M.

description: I live around the corner and was really hoping this place was good.  It was really mediocre and not the quality of Thai food we have come to expect in San Francisco.  It just was of low quality and nothing special.  The service was excellent though and professional
author: Jeff R.

description:
Caught off guard....

I know that Yelp typically is used to offer ratings to inform, and I hate bad mouthing anyone, so I will not get into too many specifics. 

My experience was very poor. For this being my first visit, the first impression of any restaurant is of the utmost importance. My first impression walking in offerred a pleasant ambiance that was not matched by the food our service.

When I was finally seated, I waited a long time to be greeted and taken care of. ( I felt as if I had come in 10 minutes before closing and restaurant had to begin prep work all over again)

I noted plenty of service staff, but they could have used better training as I waited a very long time to have my order taken, as well as for my food to arrive. The faces of other patrons were not of a good mood, so I decided to go straight for entrees figuring I would be waiting longer if i did.

The food was fair, but from studying culinary arts and have studied and traveled abroad, it just didn't match up to what I expected. Thai food is normally full of flavor and keeps you coming back for another bite until your plate is finished.  I have been in the service industry now for 23 years and have a good eye for a  restaurant that is ran smoothly. This is far from it. It most likely starts from the front of house as they can control the speed of the kitchen, the happiness of the customers, and the temperature of the food. (My food was delivered luke warm if you can call it that)

I stopped into this location on a weekday about 6:30. I could only imagine what an experience it would have been if it was a Saturday night with full seating. 

Without some major fine tuning considering the many restaurants we have in San Francisco at our fingertips, I would recommend venturing elsewhere.
author: Michael Y.

description: This has been my neighborhood go-to for convenient Thai.  There's surely better out there, but I live nearby and I appreciate that it's always been fast, consistent and friendly service.  Plus, when I ask for extra veggies on my Pad See Yu they are always accommodating.  However, the other night I called to place a take-out order and got put on hold for five minutes (think he literally put the phone down on the counter because I could hear everything in the restaurant) and eventually hung up when no one came back.  Called again, and get this - the guy told me they were very busy and said I should CALL BACK IN 20 MINUTES.  I was like, WTF?!  I'm ordering take-out (just for 2 people, mind you) which I want to eat in 20 minutes.  Anyway, was majorly disappointed and shocked at the poor customer service.  Ended up order from Lers Roos Thai right around the corner on Hayes without any issues.  Bai Thong is still on my list of neighborhood spots, but Lers Roos might have just moved into #1 position.
author: Morgan B.

description: I come to Bai Thong about once a week, since it is close to my job. I always order the Pad Thai and it is always good. The staff is friendly and helpful. They are aware of my food allergies and go the extra mile to make sure I don't have any wheat in my dishes. A cozy restaurant!
author: Tiffany C.

description: I've been here a few times, both for eat-in and carry-out. I love the fried tofu appetizer (the sweet and sour sauce that comes with it is delicious!), but everything else is not so good. They get points for being one of the few places nearby that does pad see ew, but it can be inconsistent - sometimes good, sometimes bland with overcooked meat. I also ordered a curry with potatoes once and the potatoes were pretty much raw. Not the worst place you could go for a bite, but there are definitely better out there.
author: Katie S.

description:
I heard bad things about the previous Thai Restaurant that took up this place so I had some trepidation walking in here.  Decor wasn't much and there was a fruit fly flittering around but that didn't bother me.

The food - great!  Really interesting fresh roll cut like sushi with a bit thicker rice paper.  The peanut sauce was fantastic.

We ordered spicy eggplant and tofu; and lemon chicken.  The eggplant dish was light and bursting with flavors.  The chicken was good quality and super tasty.  One of the best Thai experiences I've had in the city (and I've had my fair share of crappy thai food!).

So happy that I move to the hood and I can get take out!
author: Howard G.

description: Was hoping for a good affordable Thai place in my neighborhood! Sadly, had a bad experience: my friend's salmon dish was frozen on the inside and we sent it back. My red curry was too rich and sweet, and lacked veggies other than red pepper.
author: Chris J.

description:
Since I work/teach right around the corner, I've been coming here with colleagues several times for lunch since Bai Thong took over from Thepin Thai.  The food is definitely a step up from the level of its predecessor (which I thought was generally rather good).  My one complaint initially when this place opened was that the prices were higher than before and the portions significantly smaller.  That problem has since been remedied.  They now serve quite reasonable-sized portions, and I think the slightly higher prices are justified since the food is better.

Also, I really like the fact that the owner is so attentive and interested in his customers' satisfaction, as evidenced by his reply to one of the reviews on this site.  As a result, I'll be eating at Bai Thong this Friday evening with three friends.
author: Ken R.

description: Wonderful presentation of entree ordered. You can order very spicy or mild. If you like spicy definitely ask for it. Portions are good. I have always been very happy with whatever I have ordered.  They are able to accommodate large groups (10 people) at a moments notice.
author: Genevieve P.

description: This is the best Thai food I have had in SF after trying numerous other places.  Everything I have had has been amazing.  The owners are very kind people who have gone out of their way to grace my friends and I with their hospitality.
author: Alisa Z.

description: I've gone here several times in the last 6 months with a group of 5-7 prior to symphony and ballet events.   The food is tasty and varied.   Unlike other reviewers, other than one night where a server called in sick at the last minute (and they apologized and took something off of our bill), the service has been fantastic where they really make a special effort to please (such as giving you a 5th skewer of satay for a table of 5) and very friendly smiles and attention to our needs.   Plus, the prices are really reasonable for the area.   It's our favorite dinner place prior to performances and has food I look forward to!
author: D H.

description: the food here is awful ! My partner and I were heading to a play and stopped here for the first time. After 30 min (!) we were served. All that the beef curry needed was a stamp from Purina and my partners fish looked like a large coster. Over cooked and no meat. They apologized and slipped us the bill to a whopping $38 for unedible food. Stay away!!!
author: M F.

description: came here for lunch when my attempt to go to domo in the neighborhood was nixed.  shared the fried calamari appetizers and the pad-si ew.  portions are very big and definitely shareable, but nothing special.  my calarami dipping sauce was tasty but the calamari itself was a bit tough.  overall, i wouldn't come back unless i was really craving thai food and stuck in the hayes valley area.
author: Helen T.

description: i want to love this place because hayes valley needs a good thai restaurant, but it's frustrating that they hacked up their prices to fit in with the neighborhood. i really enjoy the food here. it's quite good, especially the pumpkin curry and the pad thai, but i feel the portions are too small and the prices are too high. i decided to try a vegetarian dish the other night, and for $9 we got a very little bit of food. i don't recommend ordering a veggie dish. if you're going to pay that much, get the curry or a rice dish. you'll fill up more. i hope they improve on things so i can start to go back there.
author: Kerri B.

description: Went here two nights in a row. LOVE the duck salad. It's very attractively presented in a salad bowl (literally) on a plate. And everything was really fresh and savory. Also had the Tom Kha (Coconut Soup) which was good but I guess there is coconut milk but no actual coconut in this one . There were a good number of customers on Friday night, but not so many that we had to wait. The Thai ice tea is good but not as good as other places I've been to. Service was fine but why is it that no matter what restaurant a person goes to the waitstaff inevitably comes over when your mouth is full of food or you're in a really good conversation and they ask you how your food is and do you need anything? And then when you would like to talk with them, they often just can't be found? Life is funny that way.... My friend had the beef salad and we both finished everything. Saturday night, due to the weather, we were the only ones in there at 8pm! But it seems to have resulted in more duck on my salad and more beef on his and a lot more chicken in our coconut soup. Also, the first night, there was sliced pear in my duck salad, the second night, no pear, but there was pineapple instead. Both were very good. Bottom line I would say, the food is three to five stars depending on which dish (we'd been before, not just these past two nights) the wood chairs are not the most comfortable, the service was good, the decor - I like the photos. Didn't care for the fluorescent green paint in the hallway to the restroom!
author: Lia H.

description: I bought a Restaurant.com coupon for this place last week. I presented it before ordering and was told they no longer accepted them.Not the deal I signed up for. I left. too bad. PlACE LOOKED NICE, SMELLED GOOD. MAYBE THE FOOD AND SERVICE ARE GOOD. I'll never know.
author: Herbert Z.

description: This place went above and beyond to make my wedding reception an exceptional one! They were so accommodating to decorate the back room they reserved for 20 plus people I bought in so beautifully with flowers, special white table cloth and silverware.  Hospitality throughout the event was so great too! Two-Three servers were constantly there to serve us with food and drinks, and not to mention, all the food were so tasty!!! (I'm a sucker for thai food and went pretty much all the well-known ones in the city, but this one is especially my favorite!!!) All the appetizers were excellent! Crispy Calamari is def one of my fav.  All the entrees were so good too! My personal fav are Ginger Stir-Fry and of course Pad Seew! My friends were raving about Emerald Fried Rice too! Overall, any food we had, we were so pleased :) We brought in our own cake but they didn't charge us for it! The owner Jin is such a nice woman and she made sure that the day was gonna go hassle-free, and yes, it was the best experience ever!  I highly recommend this place for casual dinner get together to birthday party or even a budgeted wedding reception like I did! The ambiance of the restaurant is so nice that I'd guarantee you'll love this place as soon as you'll walk in! Highly Recommended!!!!
author: Cake T.
